text: OUTSIDE OF THESE OCCASIONAL REMINDERS WE COULD SEE NO EVIDENCE OF THE DESOLATION OF THE TRACK OF AN INVADING ARMY
whisper_text: Outside of these occasional reminders, we could see no evidence of the desolation of the track of an invading army.

text: WE HAD BEEF FOR SUPPER THAT NIGHT
whisper_text: We had beef for supper that night.

text: ADVANCE INTO TENNESSEE
whisper_text: Advance into Tennessee.

text: BUT AFTER AWHILE JIM SAYS GENTLEMEN AY GANNY THE LAW
whisper_text: But after a while Jim says, gentlemen, I canning the law.

text: YOU SEE JIM KNOWED THE LAW
whisper_text: You see, Jim knows the law.

text: YANK SAYS WHAT YOU DOING JOHNNY
whisper_text: Yank says, what are you doing, Johnny?

text: HOW EVERY PULSE DID BEAT AND LEAP AND HOW EVERY HEART DID THROB WITH EMOTIONS OF JOY WHICH SEEMED NEARLY AKIN TO HEAVEN WHEN WE RECEIVED THE GLAD INTELLIGENCE OF OUR ONWARD MARCH TOWARD THE LAND OF PROMISE AND OF OUR LOVED ONES
whisper_text: How every pulse to beat and leap, and how every heart to throb with emotions of joy, which seemed nearly akin to heaven, when we received the glad intelligence of our onward march toward the land of promise and of our loved ones.

text: RIGHT BEFORE ME I SAW THE LONG DRY GRASS ALL BENDING TOWARD A COMMON CENTER AND I KNEW THAT IT WAS AN OLD WELL AND THAT MY COMRADE HAD FALLEN IN IT
whisper_text: Right before me I saw the long dry grass all bending toward a common center, and I knew that it was an old well, and that my comrade had fallen in it.

text: A YANKEE ALWAYS SAYS NAGER
whisper_text: A Yankee always says Nacker.

text: THEY PERSUADED ELOQUENTLY
whisper_text: They persuaded eloquently.

text: BUT HOW TO GET HIM OUT WAS THE UNSOLVED PROBLEM
whisper_text: But how to get him out was the unsolved problem.

text: ON MONDAY MORNING I TOO CAPTURED ME A MULE
whisper_text: On Monday morning I too captured me a mule.

text: THIS WAS THE FIRST BIG BATTLE IN WHICH OUR REGIMENT HAD EVER BEEN ENGAGED
whisper_text: This was the first big battle in which our regiment had ever been engaged.

text: SO HE GOT A LARGE TWO INCH ROPE TIED ONE END AROUND THE MULE'S NECK AND THE OTHER TO THE CAISSON AND ORDERED THE DRIVER TO WHIP UP
whisper_text: So we got a large 2-inch rope tied one end around the mules neck and the other to the case on and ordered the driver to whip up.

text: MULE DID NOT DESIRE TO CROSS WHILE I WAS TRYING TO PERSUADE HIM WITH A BIG STICK A ROCK IN HIS EAR AND A TWISTER ON HIS NOSE
whisper_text: Mule did not desire to cross, while I was trying to persuade him with a big stick, a rock and his ear, and a twister on his nose.

text: SHILOH
whisper_text: Shiloh

text: ABOUT THE TIME HE PULLED TRIGGER A STRAY BALL FROM SOME DIRECTION STRUCK HIM IN THE SIDE AND HE FELL OFF DEAD AND HIS HORSE BECOMING FRIGHTENED GALLOPED OFF DRAGGING HIM THROUGH THE CONFEDERATE LINES
whisper_text: About the time he pulled trigger a stray ball from some direction struck him in the side and he fell off dead And his horse becoming frightened galloped off dragging him through the Confederate lines

text: I HAD BEEN FEELING MEAN ALL THE MORNING AS IF I HAD STOLEN A SHEEP BUT WHEN THE ORDER TO CHARGE WAS GIVEN I GOT HAPPY
whisper_text: I had been feeling mean all the morning as if I had stolen a sheep, but when they ordered to charge who was given, I got happy.

text: THAT'S RIGHT MY BRAVE FIRST TENNESSEE GIVE EM HAIL COLUMBIA
whisper_text: That's right my brave first Tennessee, give him a hail Columbia.

text: WE WERE SUPPORTING AN ALABAMA BRIGADE
whisper_text: We were supporting an Alabama brigade.

text: I HAD HEARD AND READ OF BATTLEFIELDS SEEN PICTURES OF BATTLEFIELDS OF HORSES AND MEN OF CANNON AND WAGONS ALL JUMBLED TOGETHER WHILE THE GROUND WAS STREWN WITH DEAD AND DYING AND WOUNDED BUT I MUST CONFESS THAT I NEVER REALIZED THE POMP AND CIRCUMSTANCE OF THE THING CALLED GLORIOUS WAR UNTIL I SAW THIS
whisper_text: I had heard and read of battlefields, seen pictures of battlefields, of horses and men of cannon and wagons all jumbled together while the ground was strewn with dead and dying and wounded. But I must confess that I never realized the pomp and circumstance of the thing called glorious war until I saw this.

text: WE HAD TO PASS OVER THE GROUND WHERE TROOPS HAD BEEN FIGHTING ALL DAY
whisper_text: We had to pass over the ground where troops had been fighting all day.

text: ON SUNDAY MORNING A CLEAR BEAUTIFUL AND STILL DAY THE ORDER WAS GIVEN FOR THE WHOLE ARMY TO ADVANCE AND TO ATTACK IMMEDIATELY
whisper_text: On Sunday morning, a clear, beautiful and still day, the order was given for the whole army to advance and to attack immediately.

text: ON MONDAY THE TIDE WAS REVERSED
whisper_text: On Monday, the tide was reversed.

text: OFFICERS COULD NOT CURB THE MEN TO KEEP IN LINE
whisper_text: Officers could not curb the men to keep in line.

text: AS GLADDEN RODE BY US A COURIER RODE UP AND TOLD HIM SOMETHING
whisper_text: As Gladden wrote by us a courier wrote up and told him something.

text: THE FACT WAS KEPT FROM THE TROOPS
whisper_text: The fact was kept from the troops.

text: ABOUT DAYLIGHT ON SUNDAY MORNING CHALMERS BRIGADE RELIEVED GLADDEN'S
whisper_text: About daylight on Sunday morning, Chalmers Brigade relieved the ladders.

text: SHOULD YOU DESIRE TO FIND OUT MORE ABOUT THE BATTLE I REFER YOU TO HISTORY
whisper_text: Should you desire to find out more about the battle, I refer you to history.

text: I FREQUENTLY THOUGHT IT WOULD BE PLEASANT TO SPLIT THE DIFFERENCE WITH THAT MULE AND I WOULD GLADLY HAVE DONE SO IF I COULD HAVE GOTTEN ONE HALF OF HIS NO
whisper_text: I frequently thought it would be pleasant to split the difference with that mule, and I would gladly have done so if I could have gotten one half of his no.

text: ON MY TAKING THE ROPE OFF HE SHOOK HIMSELF AND SEEMED TO SAY YOU THINK THAT YOU ARE MIGHTY SMART FOLKS BUT YOU ARE A LEETLE TOO SMART
whisper_text: And while I'm taking the rope off, he shook himself and seemed to say, you think that you are mighty smart folks, but you are a little too smart.

text: THE ROPE HOWEVER WAS STRONGER THAN THE MULE'S NO AND HE WAS FINALLY PREVAILED UPON BY THE STRENGTH OF THE ROPE TO CROSS THE CREEK
whisper_text: The rope, however, was stronger than the mules know, and he was finally prevailed upon by the strength of the rope to cross the creek.

text: HE WAS WISE IN HIS OWN CONCEIT
whisper_text: He was wise and his own conceit.

text: BUT AS I SAID BEFORE READER A PRIVATE SOLDIER IS BUT AN AUTOMATON AND KNOWS NOTHING OF WHAT IS GOING ON AMONG THE GENERALS AND I AM ONLY GIVING THE CHRONICLES OF LITTLE THINGS AND EVENTS THAT CAME UNDER MY OWN OBSERVATION AS I SAW THEM THEN AND REMEMBER THEM NOW
whisper_text: But as I said before, Reader, a private soldier is but an automaton, and there was nothing of what is going on among the generals. And I am only giving the chronicles of little things and events that came under my own observation as I saw them then, and remember them now.

text: I DO NOT PRETEND TO TELL OF WHAT COMMAND DISTINGUISHED ITSELF OF HEROES OF BLOOD AND WOUNDS OF SHRIEKS AND GROANS OF BRILLIANT CHARGES OF CANNON CAPTURED ET CETERA
whisper_text: I did not pretend to tell of what command distinguished itself of heroes, of blood and wounds, of shrieks and groans, of brilliant charges, of canon captured, etc.

text: I SOON FOUND OUT THAT HE HAD CAUGHT SIGHT OF THE RELIEF ON THE ROAD AND WAS AFRAID TO SHOOT I QUICKLY MADE UP MY MIND
whisper_text: I soon found out that he had caught sight of the relief on the road and was afraid to shoot. I quickly made up my mind.

text: I THINK WE MUST HAVE KILLED A GOOD MANY IN THE OLD FIELD BECAUSE WE WERE FIRING ALL THE TIME AT THE SOLID LINE AS THEY ADVANCED UPON US
whisper_text: I think we must have killed a good many in the old field because we were firing all the time at the solid line as they advanced upon us.

text: BEFORE WE ARRIVED AT THE HOUSE WE SAW A BODY OF YANKEES APPROACHING AND AS WE STARTED TO RUN BACK THEY FIRED UPON US
whisper_text: Before we arrived at the house, we saw a body of Yankees approaching, and as we started to run back, they fired upon us.

text: I LOOKED AT IT PRETTY CLOSE AND I SAID GREAT GOD
whisper_text: I looked at it pretty close, and I said, great God!

text: AS I WENT BACK TO THE FIELD HOSPITAL I OVERTOOK ANOTHER MAN WALKING ALONG
whisper_text: As I went back to the field hospital, I overtook another man walking along.

text: HE WAS STONE DEAD BUT I DROPPED THAT FOOT QUICK
whisper_text: He was stone dead, but I dropped that foot quick.

text: HE DIVINED MY MOTIVE AND FIRED THE BALL MISSED ITS AIM
whisper_text: He devigned my motive and fired. The ball missed its aim.

text: SAYS HE I WOULD NOT TRUST A SECESH ON HIS WORD OATH OR BOND MARCH I SAY
whisper_text: Says he, I would not trust a secession on his word, oath or bond. March, I say.

text: OAKLEY COLOR BEARER OF THE FOURTH TENNESSEE REGIMENT RAN RIGHT UP IN THE MIDST OF THE YANKEE LINE WITH HIS COLORS BEGGING HIS MEN TO FOLLOW
whisper_text: Oakley, color bearer of the 4th Tennessee Regiment, ran right up in the midst of the Yankee line with his colors, begging his men to follow.

text: THE FEDERAL ARMY WAS CONCENTRATING AT NASHVILLE THERE WAS NO REST FOR THE WEARY
whisper_text: The Federal Army was concentrating at Nashville. There was no rest for the weary.

text: THE YANKEES MARCHED OVER THE HILL OUT OF SIGHT
whisper_text: The Yankees marched over the hill out of sight.

text: I CALLED LIEUTENANT COLONEL FRIERSON'S ATTENTION TO THE YANKEES AND HE REMARKED WELL I DON'T KNOW WHETHER THEY ARE YANKEES OR NOT BUT IF THEY ARE THEY WILL COME OUT OF THERE MIGHTY QUICK
whisper_text: I call Lieutenant Colonel Fryerson's attention to the Yankees, and he remarked, well, I don't know whether they are Yankees or not, but if they are, they will come out of their mighty quick.

text: WE REMAINED SEVERAL MONTHS BUT SOON WE WERE ON THE TRAMP AGAIN
whisper_text: We remain several months, but soon we were on the tramp again.

text: WE WERE NOT TWENTY YARDS OFF FROM THE YANKEES AND THEY WERE POURING THE HOT SHOT AND SHELLS RIGHT INTO OUR RANKS AND EVERY MAN WAS YELLING AT THE TOP OF HIS VOICE CEASE FIRING YOU ARE FIRING ON YOUR OWN MEN CEASE FIRING YOU ARE FIRING ON YOUR OWN MEN
whisper_text: We were not twenty yards off from the Yankees and they were pouring the hot shot and shells right into our ranks And every man was yelling at the top of his voice See firing you were firing on your own men. See firing you were firing on your own men

text: WE WERE RIGHT UPON THE YANKEE LINE ON THE WILKERSON TURNPIKE
whisper_text: We were right upon the Yankee line on the Wilkerson turnpike.

text: WE WERE AT THAT TIME AT LEAST A HUNDRED YARDS IN ADVANCE OF THE BRIGADE CHEATHAM ALL THE TIME CALLING UPON THE MEN TO COME ON
whisper_text: We were at that time at least a hundred yards in advance of the brigade. Cheat them all the time calling upon the men to come on.

text: THE PRIVATE COULD BUT HE WAS NO GENERAL YOU SEE
whisper_text: The private could, but he was no general you see.

text: FROM TIME TO TIME DIFFERENT REGIMENTS WERE SENT FORWARD TO DO PICKET DUTY
whisper_text: From time to time, different regiments were sent forward to do picket duty.

text: OUR ARMY STOPPED AT MURFREESBORO
whisper_text: Our army stopped at Murphreesboro.

text: BAD GENERALSHIP I THOUGHT IT WAS CHRISTMAS
whisper_text: Bad, general shit by thought. It was Christmas.

text: THE LEADEN HAIL STORM SWEPT THEM OFF THE FIELD THEY FELL BACK AND RE FORMED
whisper_text: The leaden hailstorm swept them off the field. They fell back and reformed.

text: WE WERE ORDERED FORWARD TO THE ATTACK
whisper_text: We were ordered forward to the attack.

text: LINE OF BATTLE WAS FORMED ON THE NORTH BANK OF STONE'S RIVER ON THE YANKEE SIDE
whisper_text: Line of battle was formed on the north bank of Stone's River on the Yankee side.

text: I AM A VIDET YOU KNOW THE RESPONSIBILITY RESTING ON ME
whisper_text: I am a vidat. You know the responsibility resting on me.

text: BUT I COULD NOT BEAR THE THOUGHT OF WEARING DEAD MEN'S SHOES
whisper_text: But it could not bear the thought of wearing dead men's shoes.

text: I MADE A QUICK GLANCE OVER MY SHOULDER AND GRABBED AT MY GUN
whisper_text: I made a quick glance over my shoulder and grabbed my gun.

text: I THOUGHT IT HAD BEEN TORN FROM MY SHOULDER
whisper_text: I thought it had been torn for my shoulder.

text: OUR PICKETS HAD RUN IN AND REPORTED A NIGHT ATTACK
whisper_text: Our pickets had run in and reported a night attack.

text: I SAW AND FELT THAT HE WAS NOT FIGHTING FOR GLORY BUT THAT HE WAS FIGHTING FOR HIS COUNTRY BECAUSE HE LOVED THAT COUNTRY AND HE WAS WILLING TO GIVE HIS LIFE FOR HIS COUNTRY AND THE SUCCESS OF OUR CAUSE
whisper_text: I saw and felt that he was not fighting for glory, but that he was fighting for his country because he loved that country, and he was willing to give his life for his country and the success of our cause.

text: MY GUN WAS AT MY FEET AND ONE STEP WOULD GET IT
whisper_text: My gun was at my feet and one step would get it.

text: HE WAS WALKING ALONG WHEN ALL AT ONCE HE DROPPED DOWN AND DIED WITHOUT A STRUGGLE OR A GROAN
whisper_text: He was walking along when all at once he dropped down and died without a struggle or a groan

text: THE YANKEE PICKET LINES WERE NOT A HALF MILE OFF
whisper_text: The Yankee Pigot lines were not a half mile off.

text: WE KEPT FALLING BACK AND FIRING ALL DAY AND WERE RELIEVED BY ANOTHER REGIMENT ABOUT DARK WE REJOINED OUR REGIMENT
whisper_text: We kept falling back and firing all day and were relieved by another regiment about dark. We rejoined our regiment.

text: MYSELF I ALWAYS KNEW SHE HAD IT IN HER
whisper_text: myself, I always knew she had it in her.

text: MAC CONNELL LET ME INTRODUCE MISTER BARTLEY ALEXANDER
whisper_text: McConnell, let me introduce Mr. Bartley Alexander.

text: OF COURSE HILDA IS IRISH THE BURGOYNES HAVE BEEN STAGE PEOPLE FOR GENERATIONS AND SHE HAS THE IRISH VOICE
whisper_text: Of course, Hilda is Irish. Their bergoins have been stage people for generations, and she has the Irish voice.

text: HE LEANED FORWARD AND BEAMED FELICITATIONS AS WARMLY AS MAINHALL HIMSELF WHEN AT THE END OF THE PLAY SHE CAME AGAIN AND AGAIN BEFORE THE CURTAIN PANTING A LITTLE AND FLUSHED HER EYES DANCING AND HER EAGER NERVOUS LITTLE MOUTH TREMULOUS WITH EXCITEMENT
whisper_text: He leaned forward and beamed felicitations as warmly as main hall himself when, at the end of the play, she came again and again before the curtain, panting a little and flushed. Her eyes dancing and her eager, nervous little mouth tremulous with excitement.

text: ALL THE SAME HE LIFTED HIS GLASS HERE'S TO YOU LITTLE HILDA
whisper_text: All the same. He lifted his glass. Here's to you, little hilda.

text: IT'S DELIGHTFUL TO HEAR IT IN A LONDON THEATRE
whisper_text: It's delightful to hear it in a London theatre.

text: THE PLAYWRIGHT GAVE MAINHALL A CURIOUS LOOK OUT OF HIS DEEP SET FADED EYES AND MADE A WRY FACE
whisper_text: The playwright gave main hall a curious look out of his deep-set faded eyes and made a face.

text: DO YOU KNOW ALEXANDER MAINHALL LOOKED WITH PERPLEXITY UP INTO THE TOP OF THE HANSOM AND RUBBED HIS PINK CHEEK WITH HIS GLOVED FINGER DO YOU KNOW I SOMETIMES THINK OF TAKING TO CRITICISM SERIOUSLY MYSELF
whisper_text: Do you know Alexander? Maynall looked with perplexity up into the top of the handsome, and rubbed his pink cheek with his gloved finger. Do you know, I sometimes think of taking to criticism seriously myself?

text: I SAY SIR HARRY THE LITTLE GIRL'S GOING FAMOUSLY TO NIGHT ISN'T SHE
whisper_text: I say, Sir Harry, that little girl's going famously tonight, isn't she?

text: IN A MOMENT PEGGY WAS ON THE STAGE AGAIN AND ALEXANDER APPLAUDED VIGOROUSLY WITH THE REST
whisper_text: In a moment Peggy was on the stage again, and Alexander applauded vigorously with the rest.

text: I HAPPEN TO HAVE MAC CONNELL'S BOX FOR TONIGHT OR THERE'D BE NO CHANCE OF OUR GETTING PLACES
whisper_text: I happen to have McConnell's box for tonight, or there'd be no chance of our getting places.

text: HE NODDED CURTLY AND MADE FOR THE DOOR DODGING ACQUAINTANCES AS HE WENT
whisper_text: He nodded curtly and made for the door, dodging acquaintances as he went.

text: I DARE SAY IT'S QUITE TRUE THAT THERE'S NEVER BEEN ANY ONE ELSE
whisper_text: I dare say it's quite true that there's never been anyone else.

text: ALEXANDER EXCLAIMED MILDLY
whisper_text: Alexander exclaimed mildly.

text: IN THE HALF LIGHT HE LOOKED ABOUT AT THE STALLS AND BOXES AND SMILED A LITTLE CONSCIOUSLY RECALLING WITH AMUSEMENT SIR HARRY'S JUDICIAL FROWN
whisper_text: In the half-light, he looked about at the stalls and boxes and smiled a little consciously, recalling with the amusement Sir Harry's judicial frown.

text: THE FACT IS SHE'S FEELING RATHER SEEDY POOR CHILD
whisper_text: The fact is, she's feeling rather CD poor child.

text: A LITTLE ATTACK OF NERVES POSSIBLY
whisper_text: a little attack of nerves possibly.

text: HE'S ANOTHER WHO'S AWFULLY KEEN ABOUT HER LET ME INTRODUCE YOU
whisper_text: He's another who's awfully keen about her. Let me introduce you.

text: HE HAD WRITTEN A NUMBER OF BOOKS HIMSELF AMONG THEM A HISTORY OF DANCING A HISTORY OF COSTUME A KEY TO SHAKESPEARE'S SONNETS A STUDY OF THE POETRY OF ERNEST DOWSON ET CETERA
whisper_text: He had written a number of books himself among them a history of dancing a history of costume a Key to Shakespeare sonnets a study of the poetry of Ernest Dousen etc

text: HUGH'S WRITTEN A DELIGHTFUL PART FOR HER AND SHE'S QUITE INEXPRESSIBLE
whisper_text: Hughes written a delightful part for her, and she's quite inexpressible.

text: SIR HARRY TOWNE BOWED AND SAID THAT HE HAD MET MISTER ALEXANDER AND HIS WIFE IN TOKYO
whisper_text: Sir Harry Town bowed and said that he had met Mr. Alexander and his wife in Tokyo.

whisper_text: He bowed as the warding bell rang, and main hall whispered, You know Lord Westmare, of course, the stooped man with the long gray mustache, talking to Lady Dowell.

whisper_text: When she began to dance, by way of showing the gosoons which she had seen in the ferry rings at night, the house broke into a prolonged uproar.

text: WHEN THEY ENTERED THE STAGE BOX ON THE LEFT THE FIRST ACT WAS WELL UNDER WAY THE SCENE BEING THE INTERIOR OF A CABIN IN THE SOUTH OF IRELAND
whisper_text: When they entered the stage box on the left, the first act was well underway, the scene being the interior of a cabin in the south of Ireland.

text: I'M GLAD SHE'S HELD HER OWN SINCE
whisper_text: I'm glad she's held her own since.

text: IT WAS YOUTH AND POVERTY AND PROXIMITY AND EVERYTHING WAS YOUNG AND KINDLY
whisper_text: It was youth and poverty and proximity, and everything was young and kindly.

text: AS THEY SAT DOWN A BURST OF APPLAUSE DREW ALEXANDER'S ATTENTION TO THE STAGE
whisper_text: As they sat down, a burst of applause drew Alexander's attention to the stage.

text: AFTER HER DANCE SHE WITHDREW FROM THE DIALOGUE AND RETREATED TO THE DITCH WALL BACK OF PHILLY'S BURROW WHERE SHE SAT SINGING THE RISING OF THE MOON AND MAKING A WREATH OF PRIMROSES FOR HER DONKEY
whisper_text: After her dance, she withdrew from the dialogue and retreated to the ditch wall back of Philly's burrow, where she sat singing the rising of the moon and making a wreath of prim roses for her donkey.

text: OF COURSE I KNOW BARTLEY SHE SAID AT LAST THAT AFTER THIS YOU WON'T OWE ME THE LEAST CONSIDERATION BUT WE SAIL ON TUESDAY
whisper_text: Of course, I know, Bartley," she said at last, that after this you won't owe me the least consideration. But we sail on Tuesday.

text: I'VE BEEN UP IN CANADA WITH MY BRIDGE AND I ARRANGED NOT TO COME TO NEW YORK UNTIL AFTER YOU HAD GONE
whisper_text: I've been up in Canada with my bridge and I arranged not to come to New York until after you had gone.

text: THEN YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT YOU'RE TALKING ABOUT
whisper_text: Then you don't know what you're talking about.

text: I DON'T KNOW WHAT I OUGHT TO SAY BUT I DON'T BELIEVE YOU'D BE HAPPY TRULY I DON'T AREN'T YOU TRYING TO FRIGHTEN ME
whisper_text: I don't know what I ought to say, but I don't believe you'd be happy, truly I don't. Aren't you trying to frighten me?

text: ONLY I'LL DO IT MORE COMPLETELY
whisper_text: Only I'll do it more completely.

text: BUT WHEN I CAME I THOUGHT I HAD BEEN MISTAKEN
whisper_text: But when I came, I thought I had been mistaken.

text: HE ROSE AND CROSSED THE ROOM QUICKLY
whisper_text: He rose and crossed the room quickly.

text: OH BARTLEY DID YOU WRITE TO ME
whisper_text: Oh, Bartley. Did you write to me?

text: LET ME TAKE OFF YOUR COAT AND YOUR BOOTS THEY'RE OOZING WATER
whisper_text: Let me take off your coat and your boots, their oozing water.

text: AND I SHE WHISPERED I FELT THAT YOU WERE FEELING THAT
whisper_text: And I, she whispered, I felt that you were feeling that.

text: HE BENT HIS FACE OVER HER HAIR
whisper_text: He bent his face over her hair.

text: I SAW THAT INTERVIEW IN THE PAPER YESTERDAY TELLING WHERE YOU WERE AND I THOUGHT I HAD TO SEE YOU THAT'S ALL GOOD NIGHT I'M GOING NOW
whisper_text: I saw that interview in the paper yesterday telling where you were and I thought I had to see you. That's all. Good night. I'm going now.

text: HE PAUSED THEY NEVER DID TO ME
whisper_text: He paused. They never did to me.

text: I THINK I HAVE FELT THAT YOU WERE COMING
whisper_text: I think I have felt that you were coming.

text: I TOLD MYSELF THAT IF I WERE REALLY THINKING OF YOU AND NOT OF MYSELF A LETTER WOULD BE BETTER THAN NOTHING
whisper_text: I told myself that if I were really thinking of you and not of myself, a letter would be better than nothing.

whisper_text: If you'd sent me a note or telephone to me or anything.

whisper_text: Alexander slipped his arm about her.

text: I'M GOING TO DO WHAT YOU ASKED ME TO DO WHEN YOU WERE IN LONDON
whisper_text: I'm going to do what you asked me to do when you were in London.

text: ALEXANDER FLUSHED ANGRILY
whisper_text: Alexander flushed angrily.

text: YES I KNOW VERY WELL
whisper_text: Yes, I know very well.

text: ON THE LAST SATURDAY IN APRIL THE NEW YORK TIMES PUBLISHED AN ACCOUNT OF THE STRIKE COMPLICATIONS WHICH WERE DELAYING ALEXANDER'S NEW JERSEY BRIDGE AND STATED THAT THE ENGINEER HIMSELF WAS IN TOWN AND AT HIS OFFICE ON WEST TENTH STREET
whisper_text: On the last Saturday in April, the New York Times published an account of the strike complications, which were delaying Alexander's New Jersey bridge, and stated that the engineer himself was in town and at his office on West 10th Street.

text: THEN WHEN YOUR MANAGER ADDED TWO MORE WEEKS I WAS ALREADY COMMITTED
whisper_text: Then when your manager added two more weeks, I was already committed.

text: A COAL FIRE WAS CRACKLING IN THE GRATE AND THE LAMPS WERE LIT FOR IT WAS ALREADY BEGINNING TO GROW DARK OUTSIDE

text: HILDA WATCHED HIM FROM HER CORNER TREMBLING AND SCARCELY BREATHING DARK SHADOWS GROWING ABOUT HER EYES
whisper_text: Hilda watched him from her corner, trembling and scarcely breathing, dark shadows going about her eyes.

text: PRESENTLY IT STOLE BACK TO HIS COAT SLEEVE

text: HILDA'S FACE QUIVERED BUT SHE WHISPERED YES I THINK IT MUST HAVE BEEN

text: YES HILDA I KNOW THAT HE SAID SIMPLY

text: IT IT HASN'T ALWAYS MADE YOU MISERABLE HAS IT
whisper_text: It hasn't always made you miserable, has it?

whisper_text: There is this deception between me and everything.

text: FEWER WORDS THAN BEFORE BUT WITH THE SAME MYSTERIOUS MUSIC IN THEM
whisper_text: Fewer words than before, but with the same mysterious music in them.

text: THE CHICKEN CREPT THROUGH THE PALES OF THE COOP AND RAN WITH SOME SHOW OF LIVELINESS TO HER FEET WHILE CHANTICLEER AND THE LADIES OF HIS HOUSEHOLD REGARDED HER WITH QUEER SIDELONG GLANCES AND THEN CROAKED ONE TO ANOTHER AS IF COMMUNICATING THEIR SAGE OPINIONS OF HER CHARACTER
whisper_text: The chicken crept through the pales of the coop and ran, with some show of liveliness to her feet. While Shantikler and the ladies of his household regarded her with queer, side-long glances, and then croaked one to another as if communicating their sage opinions of her character.

text: PHOEBE WONDERED WHOSE CARE AND TOIL IT COULD HAVE BEEN THAT HAD PLANTED THESE VEGETABLES AND KEPT THE SOIL SO CLEAN AND ORDERLY
whisper_text: Phoebe wondered whose care and toil it could have been that had planted these vegetables and kept the soil so clean and orderly.

text: THERE IS A WONDERFUL INSIGHT IN HEAVEN'S BROAD AND SIMPLE SUNSHINE
whisper_text: There is a wonderful insight in Heaven's broad and simple sunshine.

text: AND YET IF YOU COULD ONLY SEE THE BENIGN SMILE OF THE ORIGINAL
whisper_text: And yet, if you could only see the benign smile of the original.

text: AT SOME UNCERTAIN PERIOD IN THE DEPTHS OF NIGHT AND AS IT WERE THROUGH THE THIN VEIL OF A DREAM SHE WAS CONSCIOUS OF A FOOTSTEP MOUNTING THE STAIRS HEAVILY BUT NOT WITH FORCE AND DECISION
whisper_text: At some uncertain period in the depths of night, and as it were through the thin veil of a dream, she was conscious of a footstep mounting the stairs heavily, but not with force and decision.

text: IT WAS EVIDENT THAT THE RACE HAD DEGENERATED LIKE MANY A NOBLE RACE BESIDES IN CONSEQUENCE OF TOO STRICT A WATCHFULNESS TO KEEP IT PURE
whisper_text: It was evident that the race had degenerated, like many a noble race besides, in consequence of too strict watchfulness to keep it pure.

text: THESE FEATHERED PEOPLE HAD EXISTED TOO LONG IN THEIR DISTINCT VARIETY A FACT OF WHICH THE PRESENT REPRESENTATIVES JUDGING BY THEIR LUGUBRIOUS DEPORTMENT SEEMED TO BE AWARE
whisper_text: These feathered people had existed too long in their distinct variety, a fact of which the present representatives, judging by the Lugubrius deportment, seemed to be aware.

text: WHILE THUS DISMISSING HER THE MAIDEN LADY STEPT FORWARD KISSED PHOEBE AND PRESSED HER TO HER HEART WHICH BEAT AGAINST THE GIRL'S BOSOM WITH A STRONG HIGH AND TUMULTUOUS SWELL
whisper_text: While thus dismissing her, the maiden lady stepped forward, kissed Phoebe and pressed her to her heart, which beat against the girl's bosom with a strong, high and tumultuous swell.

text: WELL I DON'T WISH TO SEE IT ANY MORE OBSERVED PHOEBE TURNING AWAY HER EYES IT IS CERTAINLY VERY LIKE THE OLD PORTRAIT
whisper_text: Well, I don't wish to see it anymore, observe Phoebe, turning away her eyes. It is certainly very like the old portrait.

text: WHILE WE GIVE IT CREDIT ONLY FOR DEPICTING THE MEREST SURFACE IT ACTUALLY BRINGS OUT THE SECRET CHARACTER WITH A TRUTH THAT NO PAINTER WOULD EVER VENTURE UPON EVEN COULD HE DETECT IT
whisper_text: While we give it credit only for depicting the mirrorist's surface, it actually brings out the secret character with the truth that no painter would ever venture upon. Even could he detect it?

text: BEES TOO STRANGE TO SAY HAD THOUGHT IT WORTH THEIR WHILE TO COME HITHER POSSIBLY FROM THE RANGE OF HIVES BESIDE SOME FARM HOUSE MILES AWAY
whisper_text: Bees, too, strange to say, had thought it worth their while to come hither, possibly from the range of hives besides some farmhouse miles away.

text: SO WISE AS WELL AS ANTIQUE WAS THEIR ASPECT AS TO GIVE COLOR TO THE IDEA NOT MERELY THAT THEY WERE THE DESCENDANTS OF A TIME HONORED RACE BUT THAT THEY HAD EXISTED IN THEIR INDIVIDUAL CAPACITY EVER SINCE THE HOUSE OF THE SEVEN GABLES WAS FOUNDED AND WERE SOMEHOW MIXED UP WITH ITS DESTINY
whisper_text: So wise, as well as antique, was their aspect as to give color to the idea, not merely that they were the descendants of a time-honored race, but that they had existed in their individual capacity ever since the house of the Seven Gables was founded, and were somehow mixed up with its destiny.

text: HOW WONDERFULLY RESPONSIVE TO EVERY EMOTION OF THE HUMAN SOUL
whisper_text: How wonderfully responsive to every emotion of the human soul.

text: I CAN ASSURE YOU THAT THIS IS A MODERN FACE AND ONE WHICH YOU WILL VERY PROBABLY MEET
whisper_text: I can assure you that this is a modern face and one which you will very probably meet.

text: IF YOU WOULD PERMIT ME SAID THE ARTIST LOOKING AT PHOEBE I SHOULD LIKE TO TRY WHETHER THE DAGUERREOTYPE CAN BRING OUT DISAGREEABLE TRAITS ON A PERFECTLY AMIABLE FACE
whisper_text: If you would permit me, said the artist, looking at Phoebe, I should like to try whether the de-garo type can bring out disagreeable traits on a perfectly amiable face.

text: IF THE ORIGINAL IS STILL IN THE WORLD I THINK HE MIGHT DEFY THE SUN TO MAKE HIM LOOK STERN AND HARD
whisper_text: If the original is still in the world, I think he might defy the Sun to make him look stern and hard.

text: I PREFER TO THINK AND SO WOULD MISS HEPZIBAH THAT THEY RECOGNIZE THE FAMILY TONE FOR YOU ARE A PYNCHEON
whisper_text: I prefer to think, and so would Miss Hebsiva, that they recognize the family tone, for you are a pension.

text: SO WE WILL BE FELLOW LABORERS SOMEWHAT ON THE COMMUNITY SYSTEM
whisper_text: So we will be fellow laborers, somewhat on the community system.

text: WHAT AN INSTRUMENT IS THE HUMAN VOICE
whisper_text: What an instrument is the human voice.

text: HE HELD A HOE IN HIS HAND AND WHILE PHOEBE WAS GONE IN QUEST OF THE CRUMBS HAD BEGUN TO BUSY HIMSELF WITH DRAWING UP FRESH EARTH ABOUT THE ROOTS OF THE TOMATOES
whisper_text: He held a hoe in his hand, and while Phoebe was gone in quest of the crumbs, had begun to busy himself with drawing up fresh earth about the roots of the tomatoes.

text: THERE WERE ALSO A FEW SPECIES OF ANTIQUE AND HEREDITARY FLOWERS IN NO VERY FLOURISHING CONDITION BUT SCRUPULOUSLY WEEDED AS IF SOME PERSON EITHER OUT OF LOVE OR CURIOSITY HAD BEEN ANXIOUS TO BRING THEM TO SUCH PERFECTION AS THEY WERE CAPABLE OF ATTAINING
whisper_text: There were also a few species of antique and hereditary flowers and no very flourishing condition, but scrupulously weeded, as if some person, either out of love or curiosity, had been anxious to bring them to such perfection as they were capable of attaining.

text: SUMMER SQUASHES ALMOST IN THEIR GOLDEN BLOSSOM CUCUMBERS NOW EVINCING A TENDENCY TO SPREAD AWAY FROM THE MAIN STOCK AND RAMBLE FAR AND WIDE TWO OR THREE ROWS OF STRING BEANS AND AS MANY MORE THAT WERE ABOUT TO FESTOON THEMSELVES ON POLES TOMATOES OCCUPYING A SITE SO SHELTERED AND SUNNY THAT THE PLANTS WERE ALREADY GIGANTIC AND PROMISED AN EARLY AND ABUNDANT HARVEST
whisper_text: Summer squashes, almost in their golden blossom, cue combers, now evincing a tendency to spread away from the main stock and ramble far and wide. Two or three rows of string beans, and as many more that were about to festoon themselves on poles, tomatoes occupying a site so sheltered and sunny that the plants were already gigantic, and promised an early and abundant harvest.

text: THEY HAVE KNOWN ME MUCH LONGER BUT NEVER HONOR ME WITH ANY FAMILIARITY THOUGH HARDLY A DAY PASSES WITHOUT MY BRINGING THEM FOOD
whisper_text: They have known me much longer, but never honor me with any familiarity, though hardly a day passes without my bringing them food.

text: BUT PUT IT ON THE TABLE IN THE CORNER OF THE PASSAGE
whisper_text: but put it on the table in the corner of the passage.

text: SHE DID NOT ALTOGETHER LIKE HIM
whisper_text: She did not altogether like him.

text: MY NAME IS PHOEBE PYNCHEON SAID THE GIRL WITH A MANNER OF SOME RESERVE FOR SHE WAS AWARE THAT HER NEW ACQUAINTANCE COULD BE NO OTHER THAN THE DAGUERREOTYPIST OF WHOSE LAWLESS PROPENSITIES THE OLD MAID HAD GIVEN HER A DISAGREEABLE IDEA
whisper_text: My name is Phoebe Pension, said the girl, with a manner of some reserve, for she was aware that her new acquaintance could be no other than the daguerreotypeist, of whose lawless propensities the old maid had given her a disagreeable idea.

text: IS THERE NOTHING WILD IN THE EYE CONTINUED HOLGRAVE SO EARNESTLY THAT IT EMBARRASSED PHOEBE AS DID ALSO THE QUIET FREEDOM WITH WHICH HE PRESUMED ON THEIR SO RECENT ACQUAINTANCE
whisper_text: Is there nothing wild in the eye, continued wholegrave? So earnestly that it embarrassed Phoebe, as did also the quiet freedom with which she presumed on their so recent acquaintance.

text: MOST OF MY LIKENESSES DO LOOK UNAMIABLE BUT THE VERY SUFFICIENT REASON I FANCY IS BECAUSE THE ORIGINALS ARE SO
whisper_text: Most of my likenesses do look unamiable, but the very sufficient reason, I fancy, is because the originals are so.

text: THE NARRATIVE IT MAY BE IS WOVEN OF SO HUMBLE A TEXTURE AS TO REQUIRE THIS ADVANTAGE AND AT THE SAME TIME TO RENDER IT THE MORE DIFFICULT OF ATTAINMENT
whisper_text: The narrative, it may be, is woven of so humble a texture as to require this advantage, and at the same time to render it the more difficult of attainment.

text: IN GOOD FAITH HOWEVER HE IS NOT SUFFICIENTLY IMAGINATIVE TO FLATTER HIMSELF WITH THE SLIGHTEST HOPE OF THIS KIND
whisper_text: In good faith, however, he is not sufficiently imaginative to flatter himself with the slightest hope of this kind.

text: THE AUTHOR HAS CONSIDERED IT HARDLY WORTH HIS WHILE THEREFORE RELENTLESSLY TO IMPALE THE STORY WITH ITS MORAL AS WITH AN IRON ROD OR RATHER AS BY STICKING A PIN THROUGH A BUTTERFLY THUS AT ONCE DEPRIVING IT OF LIFE AND CAUSING IT TO STIFFEN IN AN UNGAINLY AND UNNATURAL ATTITUDE
whisper_text: The author has considered it hardly worth his while therefore, relentlessly to impale the story with its moral as with an iron rod, or rather as by sticking a pen through a butterfly. Thus it wants the priving of life and causing it to stiffen in an ungainly and unnatural attitude.

text: IF PERMITTED BY THE HISTORICAL CONNECTION WHICH THOUGH SLIGHT WAS ESSENTIAL TO HIS PLAN THE AUTHOR WOULD VERY WILLINGLY HAVE AVOIDED ANYTHING OF THIS NATURE
whisper_text: If permitted by the historical connection, which though slight was essential to his plan, the author would very willingly have avoided anything of this nature.

text: HE TRUSTS NOT TO BE CONSIDERED AS UNPARDONABLY OFFENDING BY LAYING OUT A STREET THAT INFRINGES UPON NOBODY'S PRIVATE RIGHTS AND APPROPRIATING A LOT OF LAND WHICH HAD NO VISIBLE OWNER AND BUILDING A HOUSE OF MATERIALS LONG IN USE FOR CONSTRUCTING CASTLES IN THE AIR
whisper_text: He trust not to be considered as unpartonably offending by laying out a street that infringes upon nobody's private rights, and appropriating a lot of land which had no visible owner, and building a house of materials long and used for constructing castles in the air.

text: WE TOOK OUR WAY THROUGH POOR AND SPARSE MEADOWS WHICH MADE A DESPERATE EFFORT EVERY YEAR TO SHOW A LITTLE GREEN
whisper_text: We took our way through poor and sparse meadows, which made a desperate effort every year to show a little green.

text: A FEW STRAY COWS AND SHEEP WERE ONLY SEEN OCCASIONALLY
whisper_text: A few stray cows and sheep were only seen occasionally.

text: WE MAY DO SO WAS MY REPLY BUT WHAT ABOUT OUR WORTHY GUIDE
whisper_text: We may do so was my reply, but what about our worthy guide?

text: I SHOULD HAVE A VIOLENT ATTACK OF THE CRAMP IF I WERE NOT TO HAVE SOME SORT OF EXERCISE
whisper_text: I should have a violent attack of the cramp if I were not to have some sort of exercise.

text: LITTLE DID I EXPECT HOWEVER THE SPECTACLE WHICH AWAITED US WHEN WE REACHED THE PENINSULA OF SNEFFELS WHERE AGGLOMERATIONS OF NATURE'S RUINS FORM A KIND OF TERRIBLE CHAOS
whisper_text: Little did I expect, however, the spectacle which awaited us when we reached the peninsula of sniffles, where agglomerations of nature's ruins form a kind of terrible chaos.

text: THEY VERY RARELY SUCCEED IN A GOOD SHOW OF YELLOW
whisper_text: They very rarely succeeded in a good show of yellow.

text: IN ANY CASE I SHALL TRUST RATHER TO MY OWN INTELLIGENCE THAN THEIRS
whisper_text: In any case, I shall trust rather to my own intelligence than theirs.

text: I THOROUGHLY UNDERSTOOD AND APPRECIATED THE NECESSITY FOR WAITING BEFORE CROSSING THE FJORD FOR THAT MOMENT WHEN THE SEA AT ITS HIGHEST POINT IS IN A STATE OF SLACK WATER
whisper_text: I thoroughly understood and appreciated the necessity for waiting before crossing the fjord, for that moment when the sea at its highest point is in a state of slack water.

text: OUR TWO HORSES WITH THE LUGGAGE FOLLOWED OF THEIR OWN ACCORD WITHOUT REQUIRING WHIP OR SPUR
whisper_text: Our two horses with the luggage, followed of their own accord, without requiring whip or spur.

text: IT CONSISTS SIMPLY OF A FEW HOUSES NOT WHAT IN ENGLAND OR GERMANY WE SHOULD CALL A HAMLET
whisper_text: It consists simply of a few houses, not what in England or Germany we should call a hamlet.

text: I TOOK OCCASION TO CONSULT THE MAP TO SEE WHERE GARDAR WAS TO BE FOUND
whisper_text: I took occasion to consult the map to see where Garder was to be found.

text: GEOGRAPHERS HAVE DIVIDED IT INTO FOUR PARTS AND WE HAD TO CROSS THE SOUTHWEST QUARTER WHICH IN THE VERNACULAR IS CALLED SUDVESTR FJORDUNGR
whisper_text: Geographers have divided it into four parts, and we had to cross the southwest quarter, which in the vernacular is called, sudwest fjordinger.

text: ACCUSTOMED AS I HAD BEEN TO THE STEAM FERRY BOATS OF THE ELBE I FOUND THE LONG OARS OF THE BOATMEN BUT SORRY MEANS OF LOCOMOTION
whisper_text: accustomed as I had been to the steam ferry boats of the Elbe, I found the long ores of the boatmen but sorry means of locomotion.

text: BUT MY UNCLE WAS IN NO HUMOR TO WAIT
whisper_text: But my uncle wasn't no humor to wait.

text: AT LENGTH THE STURDY LITTLE PONY SPREADING OUT HIS LEGS IN A STIFF AND LUDICROUS ATTITUDE GOT FROM UNDER THE PROFESSOR'S LEGS AND LEFT HIM STANDING WITH BOTH FEET ON A SEPARATE STONE LIKE THE COLOSSUS OF RHODES
whisper_text: At length, the sturdy little pony, spreading out his legs in a stiff and ludicrous attitude, got from under the professor's legs and left him standing, with both feet on a separate stone like the colossus of Rhodes.

text: THESE SACRED EDIFICES ARE HOWEVER VERY MUCH LIKE THESE PEOPLE WHO DO WITHOUT WATCHES AND NEVER MISS THEM
whisper_text: These sacred edifices are, however, very much like these people who do without watches and never miss them.

text: I BEGAN TO ENJOY THE EXHILARATING DELIGHT OF TRAVELING A LIFE OF DESIRE GRATIFICATION AND LIBERTY
whisper_text: I began to enjoy the exhilarating delight of traveling, a life of desire, gratification, and liberty.

text: HANS OUR EXTRAORDINARY GUIDE WENT FIRST WALKING WITH A STEADY RAPID UNVARYING STEP
whisper_text: Hans, our extraordinary guide, went first, walking with a steady, rapid, unvering step.

text: TO RIDE OVER SALT WATER UPON THE BACK OF A LITTLE HORSE SEEMED TO ME ABSURD
whisper_text: To ride a result water upon the back of a little horse seemed to me absurd.

text: HE SAYS TIDE REPLIED MY UNCLE TRANSLATING THE DANISH WORD FOR MY INFORMATION
whisper_text: He says, Tide replied my uncle translating the Danish word for my information.

text: MY ARMS ARE RIGHT BUT MY LEGS ARE GETTING A LITTLE STIFF
whisper_text: My arms are right, but my legs are getting a little stiff.

text: I COULD NOT HELP SMILING TO SEE HIM LOOK SO BIG ON HIS LITTLE HORSE HIS LONG LEGS NOW AND THEN TOUCHING THE GROUND MADE HIM LOOK LIKE A SIX FOOTED CENTAUR
whisper_text: I could not help smiling to see him look so big on his little horse. His long legs now and then touching the ground made him look like a six-footed centaur.

text: SNOW TEMPEST IMPRACTICABLE ROADS ROCKS ICEBERGS NOTHING STOPS HIM
whisper_text: Snow, tempest, impractable roads, rocks, icebergs, nothing stops him.

text: HERE AND THERE COULD BE SEEN AN ISOLATED FARM SOME SOLITARY BUR OR ICELANDIC HOUSE BUILT OF WOOD EARTH FRAGMENTS OF LAVA LOOKING LIKE BEGGARS ON THE HIGHWAY OF LIFE
whisper_text: Here and there could be seen an isolated farm, some solitary burr or Icelandic house, built of wood, earth, fragments of lava, looking like beggars in the highway of life.

text: A COUNTER ATTACK WAS MADE UPON WOONGA AND HE WAS DRIVEN DEEP INTO THE WILDERNESS WITH GREAT LOSS
whisper_text: A counterattack was made upon Wunga, and he was driven deep into the wilderness with great loss.

text: BUT EACH WEEK ADDED TO HIS LONELINESS AND HIS LONGINGS FOR MINNETAKI AND HIS FORESTS
whisper_text: but each week added to his loneliness and his longings for Minotaki and his forests.

text: THERE WERE TEARS IN THE BOYS EYES WHEN THEY PARTED AND THE MOTHER CRIED FOR THE INDIAN BOY WHO WAS RETURNING TO HIS PEOPLE
whisper_text: There were tears in the boy's eyes when they parted, and the mother cried for the Indian boy who was returning to his people.

text: THREE WEEKS LATER CAME WABIGOON'S REPLY
whisper_text: Three weeks later, Kamel Bigelons reply.

text: WE WILL HUNT WOLVES THE COUNTRY IS ALIVE WITH THEM AND THE GOVERNMENT GIVES A BOUNTY OF FIFTEEN DOLLARS FOR EVERY SCALP TAKEN
whisper_text: We will hunt wolves, the country is alive with them, and the government gives a bounty of $15 for every scalp taken.

text: BUT IN TIME THE END OF IT ALL CAME AND WABI WENT BACK TO THE PRINCESS MOTHER TO MINNETAKI AND TO HIS FORESTS
whisper_text: But in time, the end of it all came, and while he went back to the Princess Mother to Minotaki and to his forests.

text: AT LAST SO DARING DID HE BECOME THAT THE PROVINCIAL GOVERNMENT PLACED A PRICE UPON HIS HEAD AND UPON THOSE OF A NUMBER OF HIS MOST NOTORIOUS FOLLOWERS
whisper_text: At last, so daring did he become that the provincial government placed a price upon his head and upon those of a number of his most notorious followers.

text: WHILE THE ATTACK WAS SUCCESSFUL IN A WAY ITS MAIN PURPOSE FAILED
whisper_text: While the attack was successful in a way, its main purpose failed.

text: WABI ON THE OTHER HAND WAS AN INDIAN IN APPEARANCE FROM HIS MOCCASINS TO THE CROWN OF HIS HEAD SWARTHY SINEWY AS AGILE AS A LYNX AND WITH EVERY INSTINCT IN HIM CRYING FOR THE LIFE OF THE WILD
whisper_text: Wabi, on the other hand, was an Indian in appearance from his moccasins to the crown of his head, Swarrii, Sinui, and Agile as a links, and with every instinct in him crying for the life of the wild.

text: THERE WAS LITTLE TIME TO LOSE IN MAKING PREPARATIONS AND THE FOURTH DAY FOLLOWING THE RECEIPT OF WABI'S LETTER FOUND ROD AND HIS MOTHER WAITING FOR THE TRAIN WHICH WAS TO WHIRL THE BOY INTO HIS NEW LIFE
whisper_text: There was little time to lose in making preparations. And the fourth day, following the receipt of Wabbie's letter, found Rod and his mother waiting for the train which was to whirl the boy into his new life.

text: FROM THAT HOUR DATED ONE OF THE MOST SANGUINARY FEUDS IN THE HISTORY OF THE GREAT TRADING COMPANY A FEUD WHICH AS WE SHALL SEE WAS DESTINED TO LIVE EVEN UNTO THE SECOND GENERATION
whisper_text: From that hour, dated one of the most sanguinary feuds in the history of the great trading company, a feud which, as we shall see, was destined to live even under the second generation.

text: IT WAS AT ABOUT THIS TIME IN THEIR LIVES THAT THE WOONGAS BECAME ESPECIALLY DARING IN THEIR DEPREDATIONS
whisper_text: It was at about this time in their lives that the Wungas became especially daring in their depredations.

text: THE CHILDREN PROVED THEMSELVES UNUSUALLY BRIGHT PUPILS AND BY THE TIME WABI WAS SIXTEEN AND MINNETAKI TWELVE ONE WOULD NOT HAVE KNOWN FROM THEIR MANNER OF SPEECH THAT INDIAN BLOOD RAN IN THEIR VEINS
whisper_text: The children proved themselves unusually bright pupils, and by the time Wabi was 16 and Minotaki 12, one would not have known from their manner of speech that Indian blood ran in their veins.

text: THREE DAYS LATER MINNETAKI BECAME NEWSOME'S WIFE AT THE HUDSON BAY POST
whisper_text: Three days later, Minnetake became Newsom's wife at the Hudson Bay Post.

text: ON THE TENTH OF OCTOBER HE WOULD MEET ROD AT SPRUCEWOOD ON THE BLACK STURGEON RIVER
whisper_text: On the 10th of October, he would meet Rod at Sprucewood on the Black Sturgeon River.

text: CURIOUSLY ENOUGH THE BLOOD OF WABI RAN ALMOST PURE TO HIS INDIAN FOREFATHERS WHILE MINNETAKI AS SHE BECAME OLDER DEVELOPED LESS OF THE WILD BEAUTY OF HER MOTHER AND MORE OF THE SOFTER LOVELINESS OF THE WHITE RACE HER WEALTH OF SOFT JET BLACK HAIR AND HER GREAT DARK EYES CONTRASTING WITH THE LIGHTER SKIN OF HER FATHER'S BLOOD
whisper_text: Curiously enough, the blood of Wabi ran almost pure to his Indian forefathers, while Minotaki, as she became older, developed less of the wild beauty of her mother and more of the softer loveliness of the white race, her wealth of soft, jet-black hair and her great-dark eyes contrasting with the lighter skin of her father's blood.

text: CONSEQUENTLY BOTH MOTHER AND FATHER BEGAN THEIR EDUCATION AT THE POST THEY WERE SENT TO THE FACTOR'S SCHOOL AND TWO WINTERS WERE PASSED IN PORT ARTHUR THAT THEY MIGHT HAVE THE ADVANTAGE OF THOROUGHLY EQUIPPED SCHOOLS
whisper_text: Consequently, both mother and father began their education at the post. They were sent to the factor school, and two winters were passed in poor Arthur, that they might have the advantage of thoroughly equipped schools.

text: THE OTHER WAS A GIRL THREE YEARS YOUNGER AND NEWSOME INSISTED THAT SHE BE CALLED MINNETAKI
whisper_text: The other was a girl, three years younger, and Nusom insisted that she be called Minnetaki.

text: MEANWHILE TWO CHILDREN CAME TO BLESS THE HAPPY UNION OF NEWSOME AND HIS LOVELY INDIAN WIFE
whisper_text: Meanwhile, two children came to bless the happy union of Newsom and his lovely Indian wife.

text: ONE OF NEWSOME'S CHIEF PLEASURES IN LIFE HAD BEEN THE EDUCATING OF HIS WOODLAND BRIDE AND IT WAS THE AMBITION OF BOTH THAT THE LITTLE MINNETAKI AND HER BROTHER BE REARED IN THE WAYS OF WHITE CHILDREN
whisper_text: One of Nusom's chief pleasures in life had been the educating of his woodland bride, and it was the ambition of both that the little Minotaki and her brother be reared in the ways of white children.

text: A THOUSAND PLANS WERE MADE A THOUSAND ADVENTURES PICTURED AND THE MOTHER WOULD SMILE AND LAUGH AND PLAN WITH THEM
whisper_text: A thousand to plans were made, a thousand adventures pictured, and the mother would smile and laugh and plan with them.

text: ONE DARK NIGHT AT THE HEAD OF A SCORE OF HIS TRIBE HE FELL UPON WABIGOON'S CAMP HIS OBJECT BEING THE ABDUCTION OF THE PRINCESS
whisper_text: One dark night, at the head of a score of his tribe, he fell upon Wobigawan's camp, his object being the abduction of the princess.

text: WE SHALL MAKE MORE MONEY UP HERE THIS WINTER THAN YOU COULD EARN IN DETROIT IN THREE YEARS
whisper_text: We shall make more money up here this winter than you could earn in Detroit in three years.

text: SPRING CAME AND PASSED AND THEN SUMMER
whisper_text: Spring came in past and then summer.

text: BUT THIS POWER OF DISCERNMENT WAS DENIED THEM AND ONLY IN AFTER YEARS WITH THE LOVED ONES OF THEIR OWN FIRESIDES CLOSE ABOUT THEM WAS THE WHOLE PICTURE REVEALED
whisper_text: But this power of disarmament was denied them, and only in after years, with the loved ones of their own fire sides close about them, was the whole picture revealed.

text: NECESSITY HAD BECOME HIS GRIM MASTER AND THE FOLLOWING WEEK HE WAS GOING TO WORK
whisper_text: necessity had become his grim master and the following week he was going to work.

text: THE MEN APPEARED ROBUST BUT HEAVY FAIR HAIRED LIKE GERMANS BUT OF PENSIVE MIEN EXILES OF A HIGHER SCALE IN THE LADDER OF HUMANITY THAN THE ESKIMOS BUT I THOUGHT MUCH MORE UNHAPPY SINCE WITH SUPERIOR PERCEPTIONS THEY ARE COMPELLED TO LIVE WITHIN THE LIMITS OF THE POLAR CIRCLE
whisper_text: The men appeared robust but heavy, fair-haired like Germans, but of pensive mean, exiles of a higher scale in the latter of humanity than the Eskimos, but I thought much more unhappy, since with superior perceptions they are compelled to live within the limits of the polar circle.

text: NEARLY THE WHOLE POPULATION OF THE TOWN WAS ON FOOT TO SEE US LAND
whisper_text: Nearly the whole population of the town was on foot to CS land.

text: AT ALL EVENTS WE SHALL GET THERE SOME DAY
whisper_text: At all events, we shall get there someday.

text: NO MISTER HARDWIGG SAID THE CAPTAIN NO FEAR OF THAT
whisper_text: No, Mr. Hardwig said the captain. No fear of that.

text: ON ALL SIDES WERE TO BE SEEN WHOLE SCHOOLS OF WHALES AND SHARKS
whisper_text: On all sides were to be seen whole schools of whales and sharks.

text: I SAW BUT FEW INHABITANTS DURING MY EXCURSION BUT I MET A CROWD ON THE BEACH DRYING SALTING AND LOADING CODFISH THE PRINCIPAL ARTICLE OF EXPORTATION
whisper_text: I saw but few inhabit and stirring my excursion, but I met a crowd on the beach drying, salting, and loading codfish, the principal article of exportation.

text: WHEN THEREFORE HE ADDRESSED HIMSELF TO ME IN THE LANGUAGE OF HORACE WE AT ONCE CAME TO UNDERSTAND ONE ANOTHER
whisper_text: When, therefore, he addressed himself to me in the language of Horus, we at once came to understand one another.

text: BUT IN THE CAUSE OF SCIENCE MEN ARE EXPECTED TO SUFFER
whisper_text: but in the cause of science men are expected to suffer.

text: I SHALL BE GLAD TO CONSULT THEM
whisper_text: I shall be glad to consult them.

text: VERY LIKELY I MAY FIND THERE SOME MANUSCRIPTS FROM THE HAND OF SAKNUSSEMM
whisper_text: Very likely I may find there's some manuscripts from the hand of Suck Newsom.

text: ON THE SECOND OF THE MONTH AT TWO IN THE MORNING OUR PRECIOUS CARGO OF LUGGAGE WAS TAKEN ON BOARD THE GOOD SHIP VALKYRIE
whisper_text: On the second of the month, at 2 in the morning, our precious cargo of luggage was taken on board the Good Ship Volkery.

text: THIS MODEST SCHOLAR SPOKE NO LANGUAGES SAVE ICELANDIC AND LATIN
whisper_text: This mod of scholars spoke no languages save Icelandic in Latin.

text: MY UNCLE WAS DELIGHTED FOR MYSELF MOODY AND DISSATISFIED I APPEARED ALMOST TO EXPECT A GLIMPSE OF THE GHOST OF HAMLET
whisper_text: My uncle was delighted. For myself, Moody and dissatisfied, I appeared almost to expect a glimpse of the ghost of Hamlet.

text: THE PROFESSOR KNEW WHOM HE HAD TO DEAL WITH
whisper_text: The professor knew whom he had to deal with.

text: THOUGH NOT VERY LARGE IT APPEARED NOT LIKELY TO BE FILLED FOR CENTURIES
whisper_text: Though not very large, it appeared not likely to be filled for centuries.

text: IN THE MEANTIME THERE IS NOT AN HOUR TO LOSE

text: EVERY TIME HE BEHELD THE OBJECT OF HIS PASSION FOR HE STILL CONTINUED HIS VISITS THOUGH NOT SO FREQUENTLY AS HERETOFORE HE PLEADED HIS CAUSE WITH SUCH ARDOUR THAT MISS WOODLEY WHO WAS SOMETIMES PRESENT AND EVER COMPASSIONATE COULD NOT RESIST WISHING HIM SUCCESS
whisper_text: Every time he beheld the object of his passion, for he still continued his visits, though not so frequently as here to for, he pleaded his cause with such ardor that Miss Woodley, who was sometimes present and ever compassionate, could not resist wishing him success.

text: HE COUGHED DRANK HIS TEA ENDEAVOURED TO TALK BUT FOUND IT DIFFICULT SOMETIMES READ AND IN THIS MANNER NEAR TWO HOURS WERE PASSED AWAY WHEN MISS MILNER CAME INTO THE ROOM NOT DRESSED FOR A BALL BUT AS SHE HAD RISEN FROM DINNER
whisper_text: He coughed, drank his tea, in teber to talk but found it difficult, sometimes read, and in this manner near two hours were passed away when Miss Milner came into the room, not dressed for a ball, but as she had risen from dinner.

text: MISS WOODLEY DID NOT RECOLLECT HERSELF SO BUT WAS SO IN REALITY IN HER PEACE AND CHARITY WERE INSTINCTIVE VIRTUES ACCIDENT COULD NOT INCREASE THEM
whisper_text: Miss Woodley did not recollect herself so, but was so, in reality, in her peace and charity were instinctive virtues. Accident could not increase them.

text: SIR EDWARD NOT WHOLLY DISCOURAGED BY THE DENIAL WITH WHICH DORRIFORTH HAD WITH DELICACY ACQUAINTED HIM STILL HOPED FOR A KIND RECEPTION AND WAS SO OFTEN AT THE HOUSE OF MISSUS HORTON THAT LORD FREDERICK'S JEALOUSY WAS EXCITED AND THE TORTURES HE SUFFERED IN CONSEQUENCE CONVINCED HIM BEYOND A DOUBT OF THE SINCERITY OF HIS AFFECTION
whisper_text: Sir Edward, not wholly discouraged by the denial with which Doraphorth had, with delicacy acquainted him, still hoped for a kind reception, and was so often at the house of Mrs. Horton that Lord Frederick's jealousy was excited, and the tortures he suffered in consequence convinced him beyond a doubt of the sincerity of his affection.

text: MISS WOODLEY OBEDIENTLY SAT DOWN AND THOUGH HER THOUGHTS AND HEART WERE IN THE CHAMBER OF HER FRIEND SHE NEVER MARKED BY ONE IMPERTINENT WORD OR BY ONE LINE OF HER FACE THE RESTRAINT SHE SUFFERED
whisper_text: Miss Woodley, obediently sat down, and though her thoughts and heart were in the chamber of her friend, she never marked by one impertinent word or by one line of her face the restraint she suffered.

text: TO SYNESIUS'S MOST CHARMING LETTERS AS WELL AS TO THOSE OF ISIDORE THE GOOD ABBOT OF PELUSIUM I BEG LEAVE TO REFER THOSE READERS WHO WISH FOR FURTHER INFORMATION ABOUT THE PRIVATE LIFE OF THE FIFTH CENTURY
whisper_text: Two Sinesias' most charming letters, as well as to those of Isidore, the good abbot of Palusium, I beg leave to refer those readers who wish for further information about the private life of the 5th century.

text: THAT DIVINE WORD WHO IS THE LIGHT WHO LIGHTETH EVERY MAN WHICH COMETH INTO THE WORLD HAD AWAKENED IN THE HEART OF MANKIND A MORAL CRAVING NEVER BEFORE FELT IN ANY STRENGTH EXCEPT BY A FEW ISOLATED PHILOSOPHERS OR PROPHETS
whisper_text: That divine word, who is the light, who lighteth every man which comeeth into the world, how to awaken in the heart of mankind a moral craving never before felt in any strength except by a few isolated philosophers or prophets.

text: THE COUNTLESS TREASURES WHICH FIVE CENTURIES OF RAPINE HAD ACCUMULATED ROUND THE CAPITOL HAD BECOME THE PREY OF MEN CLOTHED IN SHEEPSKINS AND HORSE HIDE AND THE SISTER OF AN EMPEROR HAD FOUND HER BEAUTY VIRTUE AND PRIDE OF RACE WORTHILY MATCHED BY THOSE OF THE HARD HANDED NORTHERN HERO WHO LED HER AWAY FROM ITALY AS HIS CAPTIVE AND HIS BRIDE TO FOUND NEW KINGDOMS IN SOUTH FRANCE AND SPAIN AND TO DRIVE THE NEWLY ARRIVED VANDALS ACROSS THE STRAITS OF GIBRALTAR INTO THE THEN BLOOMING COAST LAND OF NORTHERN AFRICA
whisper_text: The countless treasures which five centuries of rapine had accumulated around the capital had become the prey of men clothed in sheep skins and horse hide. And the sister of an emperor had found her beauty, virtue and pride of race worthily matched by those of the hard-handed northern hero who led her away from Italy as his captive and his bride, to found new kingdoms in South France and Spain. And to drive the newly-arrived vandals across the straits of Gibraltar into the then-blooming coastland of northern Africa.

text: HOW INIQUITOUS WAS THE CONDUCT OF THE SONS OF THEODOSIUS IN REFUSING THE USUAL BOUNTY BY WHICH THE GOTHS WERE BRIBED NOT TO ATTACK THE EMPIRE THE WHOLE PENT UP DELUGE BURST OVER THE PLAINS OF ITALY AND THE WESTERN EMPIRE BECAME FROM THAT DAY FORTH A DYING IDIOT WHILE THE NEW INVADERS DIVIDED EUROPE AMONG THEMSELVES
whisper_text: How aniquitous was the conduct of the sons of Theodosius in refusing the usual bounty by which the Goths were bribed not to attack the Empire. The whole pent-up day-luch burst over the plains of Italy, and the Western Empire became from that day 4th a dying idiot, while the new invaders divided Europe among themselves.

text: NOT BE IT EVER REMEMBERED THAT THE SLIGHTEST SUSPICION OF IMMORALITY ATTACHES EITHER TO THE HEROINE OF THIS BOOK OR TO THE LEADING PHILOSOPHERS OF HER SCHOOL FOR SEVERAL CENTURIES
whisper_text: Not be it ever remembered that the slightest suspicion of immorality attaches either to the heroine of this book or to the leading philosophers of her school for several centuries.

text: THAT WONDERFUL METAPHYSIC SUBTLETY WHICH IN PHRASES AND DEFINITIONS TOO OFTEN UNMEANING TO OUR GROSSER INTELLECT SAW THE SYMBOLS OF THE MOST IMPORTANT SPIRITUAL REALITIES AND FELT THAT ON THE DISTINCTION BETWEEN HOMOOUSIOS AND HOMOIOUSIOS MIGHT HANG THE SOLUTION OF THE WHOLE PROBLEM OF HUMANITY WAS SET TO BATTLE IN ALEXANDRIA THE ANCIENT STRONGHOLD OF GREEK PHILOSOPHY WITH THE EFFETE REMAINS OF THE VERY SCIENTIFIC THOUGHT TO WHICH IT OWED ITS EXTRAORDINARY CULTURE
whisper_text: That wonderful metaphysics subtlety, which, in phrases and definitions, too often unmeaning to our grosser intellect, saw the symbols of the most important spiritual realities, and felt that on the distinction between homo-oceus and homo-ioceus might hang the solution of the whole problem of humanity, was set to battle in Alexandria, the ancient stronghold of Greek philosophy, with the effete remains of the very scientific thought to which it owed its extraordinary culture.

text: JULIAN'S LAST ATTEMPT TO RESTORE PAGANISM BY IMPERIAL INFLUENCE HAD ONLY PROVED THAT THE OLD FAITH HAD LOST ALL HOLD UPON THE HEARTS OF THE MASSES AT HIS DEATH THE GREAT TIDE WAVE OF NEW OPINION ROLLED ON UNCHECKED AND THE RULERS OF EARTH WERE FAIN TO SWIM WITH THE STREAM TO ACCEPT IN WORDS AT LEAST THE CHURCH'S LAWS AS THEIRS TO ACKNOWLEDGE A KING OF KINGS TO WHOM EVEN THEY OWED HOMAGE AND OBEDIENCE AND TO CALL THEIR OWN SLAVES THEIR POORER BRETHREN AND OFTEN TOO THEIR SPIRITUAL SUPERIORS
whisper_text: Julian's last attempt to restore paganism by imperial influence had only proved that the old faith had lost all hold upon the hearts of the masses. Had his death the great tide wave of new opinion rolled on unchecked, and the rulers of earth were feigned to swim with the stream. To accept, in words at least, the church's laws as theirs. To acknowledge a king of kings to whom even they owed homage and obedience, and to call their own slaves their poor brethren. And often too, their spiritual superiors.

text: THE HUNS SINGLY THEIR INFERIORS PRESSED THEM FROM BEHIND WITH THE IRRESISTIBLE WEIGHT OF NUMBERS ITALY WITH HER RICH CITIES AND FERTILE LOWLANDS BECKONED THEM ON TO PLUNDER AS AUXILIARIES THEY HAD LEARNED THEIR OWN STRENGTH AND ROMAN WEAKNESS A CASUS BELLI WAS SOON FOUND
whisper_text: The Huns, singly their inferior, pressed them from behind with the irresistible weight of numbers. Italy, with her rich cities and fertile lowlands, beckoned them on to plunder. As auxiliary they had learned their own strength and a Roman weakness. A Causa's belly was soon found.

text: BUT THE HEALTH OF A CHURCH DEPENDS NOT MERELY ON THE CREED WHICH IT PROFESSES NOT EVEN ON THE WISDOM AND HOLINESS OF A FEW GREAT ECCLESIASTICS BUT ON THE FAITH AND VIRTUE OF ITS INDIVIDUAL MEMBERS
whisper_text: But the health of a church depends not merely on the creed which it professes, not even on the wisdom and holiness of a few great ecclesiastics, but on the faith and virtue of its individual members.

text: THEY BROUGHT BEFORE THE MINDS OF CHURCHMEN A THOUSAND NEW QUESTIONS WHICH MUST BE SOLVED UNLESS THE CHURCH WAS TO RELINQUISH FOR EVER HER CLAIMS AS THE GREAT TEACHER AND SATISFIER OF THE HUMAN SOUL
whisper_text: They brought before the minds of church men a thousand new questions which must be solved, unless the church was to relinquish forever her claims as the great teacher and its had us fire of the human soul.

whisper_text: In the meanwhile, the minds of men, cut adrift from their ancient moorings, wandered wildly over pathless seas of speculative doubt, and especially in the more metaphysical and contemplative east, attempted to solve for themselves the questions of man's relation to the unseen by those thousand schisms, heresies, and theosophies. It is a disgrace to the word philosophy to call them by it. On the records of which the student now gazes bewildered, unable alike to count, or to explain their fantasies.

text: CLIMATE BAD EXAMPLE AND THE LUXURY OF POWER DEGRADED THEM IN ONE CENTURY INTO A RACE OF HELPLESS AND DEBAUCHED SLAVE HOLDERS DOOMED TO UTTER EXTERMINATION BEFORE THE SEMI GOTHIC ARMIES OF BELISARIUS AND WITH THEM VANISHED THE LAST CHANCE THAT THE GOTHIC RACES WOULD EXERCISE ON THE EASTERN WORLD THE SAME STERN YET WHOLESOME DISCIPLINE UNDER WHICH THE WESTERN HAD BEEN RESTORED TO LIFE
whisper_text: Climate, bad example, and the luxury of power degraded them in one century into a race of helpless and debauched slaveholders, doomed to utter extermination before the semi-gothic armies of Belisarius. And with them vanished the last chance that the Gothic races would exercise on the Eastern world, the same stern yet wholesome discipline under which the Western had been restored to life.

text: IN THE PRESENT CASE THAT DISADVANTAGE IS DOUBLED FOR WHILE THE SINS OF THE CHURCH HOWEVER HEINOUS WERE STILL SUCH AS ADMIT OF BEING EXPRESSED IN WORDS THE SINS OF THE HEATHEN WORLD AGAINST WHICH SHE FOUGHT WERE UTTERLY INDESCRIBABLE AND THE CHRISTIAN APOLOGIST IS THUS COMPELLED FOR THE SAKE OF DECENCY TO STATE THE CHURCH'S CASE FAR MORE WEAKLY THAN THE FACTS DESERVE
whisper_text: In the present case, that disadvantage is doubled. For while the sins of the Church, however heinous, were still such as admit of being expressed in words, the sins of the heathen world against which she fought were utterly indescribable, and the Christian apologist is thus compelled for the sake of decency to state the church's case far more weekly than the facts deserve.
