whisper_text: He saw that his choirs, for so they called those who followed that trade, were about to rifle San Chopanza, but he ordered them to desist and was at once obeyed. So the girdle escaped.

text: MASTER AND MAN DISMOUNTED FROM THEIR BEASTS AND AS SOON AS THEY HAD SETTLED THEMSELVES AT THE FOOT OF THE TREES SANCHO WHO HAD HAD A GOOD NOONTIDE MEAL THAT DAY LET HIMSELF WITHOUT MORE ADO PASS THE GATES OF SLEEP
whisper_text: Master and man dismounted from their beasts, and as soon as they had settled themselves at the foot of the trees, Sancho, who had had a good noon-tine meal that day, let himself, without Moradu, passed the gates of sleep.

text: NOBODY NEED HAVE ANY DOUBT ABOUT THAT SAID SANCHO FOR MY MASTER HAS A VERY HAPPY KNACK OF MATCHMAKING IT'S NOT MANY DAYS SINCE HE FORCED ANOTHER MAN TO MARRY WHO IN THE SAME WAY BACKED OUT OF HIS PROMISE TO ANOTHER MAIDEN AND IF IT HAD NOT BEEN FOR HIS PERSECUTORS THE ENCHANTERS CHANGING THE MAN'S PROPER SHAPE INTO A LACQUEY'S THE SAID MAIDEN WOULD NOT BE ONE THIS MINUTE
whisper_text: Nobody need have any doubt about that," said Sancio. For my master has a very happy knack of matchmaking. It's not many days since he forced another man to marry, who, in the same way, backed out of his promise to another maiden. And if it had not been for his persecutors, the enchanters, changing the man's proper shape into a lackeys, the said maiden would not be one this minute."

text: AND NOW THE SQUIRES DESPATCHED TO MAKE THE PRIZE CAME UP BRINGING WITH THEM TWO GENTLEMEN ON HORSEBACK TWO PILGRIMS ON FOOT AND A COACH FULL OF WOMEN WITH SOME SIX SERVANTS ON FOOT AND ON HORSEBACK IN ATTENDANCE ON THEM AND A COUPLE OF MULETEERS WHOM THE GENTLEMEN HAD WITH THEM
whisper_text: And now the squires dispatched to make the prize came up, bringing with them two gentlemen on horseback, two pilgrims on foot, and a coach full of women with some six servants on foot and on horseback and attendants on them, and a couple of mule tears whom the gentlemen had with them.

text: THE CAPTAINS SHOWED PLAINLY THE CONCERN THEY FELT THE REGENT'S LADY WAS DOWNCAST AND THE PILGRIMS DID NOT AT ALL ENJOY SEEING THEIR PROPERTY CONFISCATED
whisper_text: The captains showed plainly the concern they felt. The regents' lady was downcast, and the pilgrims did not at all enjoy seeing their property confiscated.

text: THEY MADE HASTE TO OVERTAKE THEM WHICH AS THE PARTY MOVED SLOWLY THEY WERE ABLE TO DO WITH EASE
whisper_text: They made haste to overtake them, which as the party moved slowly they were able to do with these.

text: BUT DON QUIXOTE WHOM HIS THOUGHTS FAR MORE THAN HUNGER KEPT AWAKE COULD NOT CLOSE AN EYE AND ROAMED IN FANCY TO AND FRO THROUGH ALL SORTS OF PLACES
whisper_text: But don Qu'ote, whom his thoughts far more than hunger kept awake, could not close an eye, and roamed in fancy to and fro through all sorts of places.

text: THEY WERE ALL TAKEN ABACK AND NOT ONE OF THEM DARED TO UTTER A WORD SUCH DEFERENCE DID THEY PAY HIM
whisper_text: They were all taken aback, and not one of them dared to utter a word, such deference did they pay him.

text: HE SAW ME HE PAID COURT TO ME I LISTENED TO HIM AND UNKNOWN TO MY FATHER I LOVED HIM FOR THERE IS NO WOMAN HOWEVER SECLUDED SHE MAY LIVE OR CLOSE SHE MAY BE KEPT WHO WILL NOT HAVE OPPORTUNITIES AND TO SPARE FOR FOLLOWING HER HEADLONG IMPULSES
whisper_text: He saw me, he paid court to me, I listened to him, and unknown to my father, I loved him. For there is no woman, however secluded she may live, or close she may be kept, who will not have opportunities and despair for following her head long impulses.

text: O HUSBAND WHOSE UNHAPPY FATE IN BEING MINE HATH BORNE THEE FROM THE MARRIAGE BED TO THE GRAVE
whisper_text: Oh husband, whose unhappy fate in being mine hath borne thee from the marriage bed to the grave.

text: SANCHO SAID THEY HAD BUT THAT THREE KERCHIEFS THAT WERE WORTH THREE CITIES WERE MISSING
whisper_text: Sanchez said they had, but the three Kirchiffs that were worth three cities were missing.

text: SANCHO ROSE AND REMOVED SOME DISTANCE FROM THE SPOT BUT AS HE WAS ABOUT TO PLACE HIMSELF LEANING AGAINST ANOTHER TREE HE FELT SOMETHING TOUCH HIS HEAD AND PUTTING UP HIS HANDS ENCOUNTERED SOMEBODY'S TWO FEET WITH SHOES AND STOCKINGS ON THEM
whisper_text: Sancho rose and removed some distance from the spot, but as he was about to place himself leaning against another tree, he felt something touch his head, and putting up his hands and countered somebody's two feet with shoes and stockings on them.

text: HOW NOW TRAITOR EXCLAIMED DON QUIXOTE
whisper_text: Oh no traitor! Explain, don't look here today.

text: DOST THOU REVOLT AGAINST THY MASTER AND NATURAL LORD
whisper_text: Dust out revolt against thy master and natural lord!

text: HE TREMBLED WITH FEAR AND MADE FOR ANOTHER TREE WHERE THE VERY SAME THING HAPPENED TO HIM AND HE FELL A SHOUTING CALLING UPON DON QUIXOTE TO COME AND PROTECT HIM
whisper_text: He trembled with fear and made for another tree where the very same thing happened to him and he fell a shouting calling upon Dongkyoji to come and protect him.

text: WHAT ARE YOU TALKING ABOUT MAN
whisper_text: What are you talking about, man?

text: THE SERVANTS WEPT CLAUDIA SWOONED AWAY AGAIN AND AGAIN AND THE WHOLE PLACE SEEMED A FIELD OF SORROW AND AN ABODE OF MISFORTUNE
whisper_text: The servants wept. Claudius swooned away again and again, and the whole place seemed a field of sorrow and an abode of misfortune.

text: THE PAST HE REGRETTED HE WAS DISCONTENTED WITH THE PRESENT AND THE FUTURE HE HAD REASON TO DREAD THE ORIENTAL BISHOPS SUCCESSIVELY DISENGAGED THEIR CAUSE FROM HIS UNPOPULAR NAME AND EACH DAY DECREASED THE NUMBER OF THE SCHISMATICS WHO REVERED NESTORIUS AS THE CONFESSOR OF THE FAITH
whisper_text: The past he regretted. He was discontented with the present, and the future he had reason to dread. The Oriental bishops, successively, disengaged their cause from his unpopular name, and each day decreased the number of the schismatics who revered Nostoreus as the confessor of the faith.

text: THE ZEAL OF CYRIL EXPOSED HIM TO THE PENALTIES OF THE JULIAN LAW BUT IN A FEEBLE GOVERNMENT AND A SUPERSTITIOUS AGE HE WAS SECURE OF IMPUNITY AND EVEN OF PRAISE
whisper_text: The zeal of Carol exposed him to the penalties of the Julian Law, but in a feeble government and a superstitious age, he was secure of impunity and even of praise.

text: RETURN TO YOUR PROVINCES AND MAY YOUR PRIVATE VIRTUES REPAIR THE MISCHIEF AND SCANDAL OF YOUR MEETING
whisper_text: Return to your provinces and pay your private virtues repair the mischief and scandal of your meeting.

text: DURING A BUSY PERIOD OF THREE MONTHS THE EMPEROR TRIED EVERY METHOD EXCEPT THE MOST EFFECTUAL MEANS OF INDIFFERENCE AND CONTEMPT TO RECONCILE THIS THEOLOGICAL QUARREL
whisper_text: During a busy period of three months, the Emperor tried every method except the most effectual means of indifference and contempt to reconcile this theological quarrel.

text: SUCH CRIMES WOULD HAVE DESERVED THE ANIMADVERSION OF THE MAGISTRATE BUT IN THIS PROMISCUOUS OUTRAGE THE INNOCENT WERE CONFOUNDED WITH THE GUILTY AND ALEXANDRIA WAS IMPOVERISHED BY THE LOSS OF A WEALTHY AND INDUSTRIOUS COLONY
whisper_text: Such crimes would have deserved the animate version of the magistrate, but in this promiscuous outrage, the innocent were confounded with the guilty, and Alexandria was impoverished by the loss of a wealthy and industrious colony.

text: AT THE SAME TIME EVERY AVENUE OF THE THRONE WAS ASSAULTED WITH GOLD
whisper_text: At the same time, every avenue of the throne was assaulted with gold.

text: A RUMOR WAS SPREAD AMONG THE CHRISTIANS THAT THE DAUGHTER OF THEON WAS THE ONLY OBSTACLE TO THE RECONCILIATION OF THE PRAEFECT AND THE ARCHBISHOP AND THAT OBSTACLE WAS SPEEDILY REMOVED
whisper_text: A rumor was spread among the Christians that the daughter of Theon was the only obstacle to the reconciliation of the prefect in the Archbishop, and that obstacle was spedily removed.

text: BY THE VIGILANCE OF MEMNON THE CHURCHES WERE SHUT AGAINST THEM AND A STRONG GARRISON WAS THROWN INTO THE CATHEDRAL
whisper_text: By the vigilance of Memnon, the churches were shot against them, and a strong garrison was thrown into the cathedral.

text: BUT THE VATICAN RECEIVED WITH OPEN ARMS THE MESSENGERS OF EGYPT
whisper_text: but the Vatican received with open arms the messengers of Egypt.

text: AT THESE BLASPHEMOUS SOUNDS THE PILLARS OF THE SANCTUARY WERE SHAKEN
whisper_text: At these blasts from a sound, the pillars of the sanctuary were shaken.

text: SIXTY EIGHT BISHOPS TWENTY TWO OF METROPOLITAN RANK DEFENDED HIS CAUSE BY A MODEST AND TEMPERATE PROTEST THEY WERE EXCLUDED FROM THE COUNCILS OF THEIR BRETHREN
whisper_text: 68 bishops, 22 of Metropolitan Rank, defended his cause by a modest and temperate protest. They were excluded from the councils of their brethren.

text: ORESTES COMPLAINED BUT HIS JUST COMPLAINTS WERE TOO QUICKLY FORGOTTEN BY THE MINISTERS OF THEODOSIUS AND TOO DEEPLY REMEMBERED BY A PRIEST WHO AFFECTED TO PARDON AND CONTINUED TO HATE THE PRAEFECT OF EGYPT
whisper_text: Oresti is complained, but his just complaints were too quickly forgotten by the ministers of theodosius, and too deeply remembered by a priest who affected to pardon and continued to hate the prefective Egypt.

text: NESTORIUS WHO DEPENDED ON THE NEAR APPROACH OF HIS EASTERN FRIENDS PERSISTED LIKE HIS PREDECESSOR CHRYSOSTOM TO DISCLAIM THE JURISDICTION AND TO DISOBEY THE SUMMONS OF HIS ENEMIES THEY HASTENED HIS TRIAL AND HIS ACCUSER PRESIDED IN THE SEAT OF JUDGMENT
whisper_text: Nistorius, who depended on the near approach of his Eastern friends, persisted, like his predecessor, Chrysostom, to disclaim the jurisdiction and to disobey the summons of his enemies. They hastened his trial, and his accuser presided in the seat of judgment.

text: EXTERMINATE WITH ME THE HERETICS AND WITH YOU I WILL EXTERMINATE THE PERSIANS
whisper_text: exterminate with me the heretics and with you I will exterminate the Persians.

text: WHICH OPPRESSED THE METROPOLITANS OF EUROPE AND ASIA INVADED THE PROVINCES OF ANTIOCH AND ALEXANDRIA AND MEASURED THEIR DIOCESE BY THE LIMITS OF THE EMPIRE
whisper_text: which oppressed the metropolitan of Europe and Asia, invaded the provinces of Antioch and Alexandria, and measured their diocese by the limits of the Empire.

text: THE VANITY OF CELESTINE WAS FLATTERED BY THE APPEAL AND THE PARTIAL VERSION OF A MONK DECIDED THE FAITH OF THE POPE WHO WITH HIS LATIN CLERGY WAS IGNORANT OF THE LANGUAGE THE ARTS AND THE THEOLOGY OF THE GREEKS
whisper_text: The vanity of Kellestine was flattered by the appeal, and the partial version of a monk decided the faith of the Pope, who with his Latin clergy was ignorant of the language, the arts, and the theology of the Greeks.

text: BUT IN THIS AWFUL MOMENT OF THE DANGER OF THE CHURCH THEIR VOW WAS SUPERSEDED BY A MORE SUBLIME AND INDISPENSABLE DUTY
whisper_text: But in this awful moment of the danger of the church, their vow was superseded by a more sublime and indispensable duty.

text: WITHOUT ANY LEGAL SENTENCE WITHOUT ANY ROYAL MANDATE THE PATRIARCH AT THE DAWN OF DAY LED A SEDITIOUS MULTITUDE TO THE ATTACK OF THE SYNAGOGUES
whisper_text: Without any legal sentence, without any royal mandate, the patriarch at the dawn of the day led a seditious multitude to the attack of the synagogues.

text: ARDENT IN THE PROSECUTION OF HERESY CYRIL AUSPICIOUSLY OPENED HIS REIGN BY OPPRESSING THE NOVATIANS THE MOST INNOCENT AND HARMLESS OF THE SECTARIES
whisper_text: ardent in the prosecution of heresy, Carol auspiciously opened his reign by oppressing the novations, the most innocent and harmless of the sectaries.

text: THE FEEBLE SON OF ARCADIUS WAS ALTERNATELY SWAYED BY HIS WIFE AND SISTER BY THE EUNUCHS AND WOMEN OF THE PALACE SUPERSTITION AND AVARICE WERE THEIR RULING PASSIONS AND THE ORTHODOX CHIEFS WERE ASSIDUOUS IN THEIR ENDEAVORS TO ALARM THE FORMER AND TO GRATIFY THE LATTER
whisper_text: The feeble son of Arcadiaus was alternately swayed by his wife and sister, by the unix and women of the palace. Supercision and averse were their ruling passions, and the Orthodox chiefs were asidious in their endeavors to alarm the former, and to gratify the latter.

text: A WANDERING TRIBE OF THE BLEMMYES OR NUBIANS INVADED HIS SOLITARY PRISON IN THEIR RETREAT THEY DISMISSED A CROWD OF USELESS CAPTIVES BUT NO SOONER HAD NESTORIUS REACHED THE BANKS OF THE NILE THAN HE WOULD GLADLY HAVE ESCAPED FROM A ROMAN AND ORTHODOX CITY TO THE MILDER SERVITUDE OF THE SAVAGES
whisper_text: A wandering tribe of the Blemais or Nubians invaded his solitary prison. In their retreat, they dismissed a crowd of useless captives, but no sooner had Nisterius reached the banks of the Nile than he would gladly have escaped from a Roman and orthodox city to the milder servitude of the savages.

text: WHEN THE MESSIAH WAS DELIVERED INTO THE HANDS OF THE JEWS THE CHRIST AN IMMORTAL AND IMPASSIBLE BEING FORSOOK HIS EARTHLY TABERNACLE FLEW BACK TO THE PLEROMA OR WORLD OF SPIRITS AND LEFT THE SOLITARY JESUS TO SUFFER TO COMPLAIN AND TO EXPIRE
whisper_text: When the Messiah was delivered into the hands of the Jews, the Christ and immortal and impassable being for sook his earthly tabernacle flew back to the plerima or world of spirits and left the solitary Jesus to suffer, to complain, and to expire.

text: THE SON OF A VIRGIN GENERATED BY THE INEFFABLE OPERATION OF THE HOLY SPIRIT WAS A CREATURE WITHOUT EXAMPLE OR RESEMBLANCE SUPERIOR IN EVERY ATTRIBUTE OF MIND AND BODY TO THE CHILDREN OF ADAM
whisper_text: The son of a virgin, generated by the ineffable operation of the Holy Spirit, was a creature without example or resemblance, superior in every attribute of mind and body to the children of Adam.

text: HE FIRST APPEARED ON THE BANKS OF THE JORDAN IN THE FORM OF PERFECT MANHOOD BUT IT WAS A FORM ONLY AND NOT A SUBSTANCE A HUMAN FIGURE CREATED BY THE HAND OF OMNIPOTENCE TO IMITATE THE FACULTIES AND ACTIONS OF A MAN AND TO IMPOSE A PERPETUAL ILLUSION ON THE SENSES OF HIS FRIENDS AND ENEMIES
whisper_text: He first appeared on the banks of the Jordan in the form of perfect manhood, but it was a form only, and not a substance, a human figure created by the hand of omnipotence to imitate the faculties and actions of a man, and to impose a perpetual illusion on the senses of his friends and enemies.

text: MANY AMONG THE GENTILE PROSELYTES REFUSED TO BELIEVE THAT A CELESTIAL SPIRIT AN UNDIVIDED PORTION OF THE FIRST ESSENCE HAD BEEN PERSONALLY UNITED WITH A MASS OF IMPURE AND CONTAMINATED FLESH AND IN THEIR ZEAL FOR THE DIVINITY THEY PIOUSLY ABJURED THE HUMANITY OF CHRIST
whisper_text: Many among the Gentile presulites refused to believe that a celestial spirit, an undivided portion of the first essence, had been personally united with a mass of impure and contaminated flesh, and in their zeal for the divinity, they piously absurd the humanity of Christ.

text: HE LIVED AND DIED FOR THE SERVICE OF MANKIND BUT THE LIFE AND DEATH OF SOCRATES HAD LIKEWISE BEEN DEVOTED TO THE CAUSE OF RELIGION AND JUSTICE AND ALTHOUGH THE STOIC OR THE HERO MAY DISDAIN THE HUMBLE VIRTUES OF JESUS THE TEARS WHICH HE SHED OVER HIS FRIEND AND COUNTRY MAY BE ESTEEMED THE PUREST EVIDENCE OF HIS HUMANITY
whisper_text: He lived and died for the service of mankind, but the life and death of Socrates had likewise been devoted to the cause of religion and justice, and although the stoic or the hero may disdain the humble virtues of Jesus, the tears which he shed over his friend and country may be esteemed the purest evidence of his humanity.

text: IN THEIR EYES JESUS OF NAZARETH WAS A MERE MORTAL THE LEGITIMATE SON OF JOSEPH AND MARY BUT HE WAS THE BEST AND WISEST OF THE HUMAN RACE SELECTED AS THE WORTHY INSTRUMENT TO RESTORE UPON EARTH THE WORSHIP OF THE TRUE AND SUPREME DEITY
whisper_text: In their eyes, Jesus of Nazareth was a mere mortal. The legitimate son of Joseph and Mary, but he was the best and wisest of the human race, selected as the worthy instruments to restore upon earth the worship of the true and supreme deity.

text: BUT INSTEAD OF A TEMPORARY AND OCCASIONAL ALLIANCE THEY ESTABLISHED AND WE STILL EMBRACE THE SUBSTANTIAL INDISSOLUBLE AND EVERLASTING UNION OF A PERFECT GOD WITH A PERFECT MAN OF THE SECOND PERSON OF THE TRINITY WITH A REASONABLE SOUL AND HUMAN FLESH
whisper_text: But instead of a temporary and occasional alliance, they established and we seal embrace the substantial, indesoluble and everlasting union of a perfect God with a perfect man, of the second person of the Trinity with a reasonable soul and human flesh.

text: THEIR MURMURS WERE VARIOUSLY SILENCED BY THE SECTARIES WHO ESPOUSED AND MODIFIED THE DOUBLE SYSTEM OF CERINTHUS
whisper_text: Their murmurs were variously silenced by the sectaries who espoused and modified the double system of Corinthus.

text: HIS PROGRESS FROM INFANCY TO YOUTH AND MANHOOD WAS MARKED BY A REGULAR INCREASE IN STATURE AND WISDOM AND AFTER A PAINFUL AGONY OF MIND AND BODY HE EXPIRED ON THE CROSS
whisper_text: His progress from infancy to youth and manhood was marked by a regular increase in stature and wisdom, and after a painful agony of mind and body he expired on the cross.

text: YET THE MOST CHARITABLE CRITICISM MUST REFUSE THESE SECTARIES ANY KNOWLEDGE OF THE PURE AND PROPER DIVINITY OF CHRIST
whisper_text: Yet the most charitable criticism must refuse these sectaries any knowledge of the pure and proper divinity of Christ.

text: BUT THE JUSTICE AND GENEROSITY OF SUCH A DESERTION ARE STRONGLY QUESTIONABLE AND THE FATE OF AN INNOCENT MARTYR AT FIRST IMPELLED AND AT LENGTH ABANDONED BY HIS DIVINE COMPANION MIGHT PROVOKE THE PITY AND INDIGNATION OF THE PROFANE
whisper_text: But the justice and generosity of such a desertion are strongly questionable, and the fate of an innocent martyr at first impelled and at length abandoned by his divine companion might provoke the pity and indignation of the profane.

text: HE ACQUIESCED IN THE OLD DISTINCTION OF THE GREEK PHILOSOPHERS BETWEEN THE RATIONAL AND SENSITIVE SOUL OF MAN THAT HE MIGHT RESERVE THE LOGOS FOR INTELLECTUAL FUNCTIONS AND EMPLOY THE SUBORDINATE HUMAN PRINCIPLE IN THE MEANER ACTIONS OF ANIMAL LIFE
whisper_text: He acquiesced in the old distinction of the Greek philosopher as between the rational and sensitive soul of man, that he might reserve the logos for intellectual functions, and employ the subordinate human principle in the meaner actions of animal life.

text: THEIR CHURCHES HAVE DISAPPEARED THEIR BOOKS ARE OBLITERATED THEIR OBSCURE FREEDOM MIGHT ALLOW A LATITUDE OF FAITH AND THE SOFTNESS OF THEIR INFANT CREED WOULD BE VARIOUSLY MOULDED BY THE ZEAL OR PRUDENCE OF THREE HUNDRED YEARS
whisper_text: Their churches have disappeared, their books are obliterated, their obscure freedom might allow a latitude of faith, and the softness of their infant creed would be variously molded by the zeal or prudence of 300 years.

text: YET AS THE PROFOUND DOCTOR HAD BEEN TERRIFIED AT HIS OWN RASHNESS APOLLINARIS WAS HEARD TO MUTTER SOME FAINT ACCENTS OF EXCUSE AND EXPLANATION
whisper_text: Yet, as the profound doctor had been terrified of his own rationalist, a Polinaris was heard to mutter some faint accents of excuse in explanation.

text: THE WORTHY FRIEND OF ATHANASIUS THE WORTHY ANTAGONIST OF JULIAN HE BRAVELY WRESTLED WITH THE ARIANS AND POLYTHEISTS AND THOUGH HE AFFECTED THE RIGOR OF GEOMETRICAL DEMONSTRATION HIS COMMENTARIES REVEALED THE LITERAL AND ALLEGORICAL SENSE OF THE SCRIPTURES
whisper_text: The worthy friend of Athanasius, the worthy antagonist of Julian, he bravely wrestled with the Aryans and polypheists, and though he affected the rigor of geometrical demonstration, his commentaries revealed the literal and allegorical sense of the scriptures.

text: A LAUDABLE REGARD FOR THE HONOR OF THE FIRST PROSELYTE HAS COUNTENANCED THE BELIEF THE HOPE THE WISH THAT THE EBIONITES OR AT LEAST THE NAZARENES WERE DISTINGUISHED ONLY BY THEIR OBSTINATE PERSEVERANCE IN THE PRACTICE OF THE MOSAIC RITES
whisper_text: A laudable regard for the honor of the First Prasolite has countenst the belief, the hope, the wish, that the Ebionites, or at least the Nazarens, were distinguished only by their opposite perseverance in the practice of the Mosaic rights.

text: UNDER THE TUITION OF THE ABBOT SERAPION HE APPLIED HIMSELF TO ECCLESIASTICAL STUDIES WITH SUCH INDEFATIGABLE ARDOR THAT IN THE COURSE OF ONE SLEEPLESS NIGHT HE HAS PERUSED THE FOUR GOSPELS THE CATHOLIC EPISTLES AND THE EPISTLE TO THE ROMANS
whisper_text: Under the tuition of the Abbott Serapian, he applied himself to ecclesiastical studies with such indefatigable order that in the course of one sleepless night he has perused the four gospels, the Catholic epistles, and the epistles of the Romans.

text: BUT THE PREVAILING DOCTRINE OF THE ETERNITY AND INHERENT PRAVITY OF MATTER INFECTED THE PRIMITIVE CHURCHES OF THE EAST
whisper_text: But the prevailing doctrine of the eternity and inherent and even the depravity of matter infected the primitive churches of the East.

text: A FOETUS THAT COULD INCREASE FROM AN INVISIBLE POINT TO ITS FULL MATURITY A CHILD THAT COULD ATTAIN THE STATURE OF PERFECT MANHOOD WITHOUT DERIVING ANY NOURISHMENT FROM THE ORDINARY SOURCES MIGHT CONTINUE TO EXIST WITHOUT REPAIRING A DAILY WASTE BY A DAILY SUPPLY OF EXTERNAL MATTER
whisper_text: A fetus that could increase from an invisible point to its full maturity. A child that could attain the stature of perfect madhood without deriving any nourishment from the ordinary sources might continue to exist without repairing a daily waste by a daily supply of external matter.

text: BUT THE RASHNESS OF THESE CONCESSIONS HAS ENCOURAGED A MILDER SENTIMENT OF THOSE OF THE DOCETES WHO TAUGHT NOT THAT CHRIST WAS A PHANTOM BUT THAT HE WAS CLOTHED WITH AN IMPASSIBLE AND INCORRUPTIBLE BODY
whisper_text: But the rashness of these concessions has encouraged a milder sentiment of those of the dosi, who taught not that Christ was a phantom, but that he was clothed with an impassable and incorruptible body.

text: NOR COULD IT SEEM STRANGE OR INCREDIBLE THAT THE FIRST OF THESE AEONS THE LOGOS OR WORD OF GOD OF THE SAME SUBSTANCE WITH THE FATHER SHOULD DESCEND UPON EARTH TO DELIVER THE HUMAN RACE FROM VICE AND ERROR AND TO CONDUCT THEM IN THE PATHS OF LIFE AND IMMORTALITY
whisper_text: Nor could it seem strange or incredible that the first of these eons, the Logos, or Word of God, of the same substance with the Father, should descend upon Earth to deliver the human race from vice and error, and to conduct them in the paths of life and immortality.

text: THE LOSS OF HIS TWO FRIENDS HAD A DEPRESSING EFFECT UPON OLD MISTER SHIMERDA
whisper_text: The loss of his two friends had a depressing effect upon old Mr. Shamarida.

text: FROM OUR BENCH WE COULD SEE WHAT A HOLLOW CASE HIS BODY WAS
whisper_text: From our bench, we could see what a hollow case his body was.

text: SHE ASKED PETER TO WAIT A MOMENT AND WHEN SHE CAME BACK FROM THE KITCHEN SHE BROUGHT A BAG OF SANDWICHES AND DOUGHNUTS FOR US
whisper_text: She asked Peter to wait a moment, and when she came back from the kitchen, she brought a bag of sandwiches and donuts for us.

whisper_text: The shrieks that followed meant everybody sober.

whisper_text: Wherever they went, the story followed them.

whisper_text: They worked in Chicago, Des Moines, Fort Wayne, but they were always unfortunate.

whisper_text: The road was clear and white and the groom's three blacks went like the wind.

whisper_text: We lay still and did not talk.

whisper_text: Gradually, relief came to all of us.

whisper_text: When he was out hunting, he used to go into the empty log house and sit there, brooding.

text: THERE ARE ONLY THREE SLEDGES LEFT HE WHISPERED
whisper_text: There are only three slages left, you whispered.

text: THE FIRST THING EITHER OF THEM NOTICED WAS A NEW SOUND THAT BROKE INTO THE CLEAR AIR LOUDER THAN THEY HAD EVER HEARD IT BEFORE THE BELL OF THE MONASTERY OF THEIR OWN VILLAGE RINGING FOR EARLY PRAYERS
whisper_text: The first thing either of them noticed was a new sound that broke into the clean air. Louder than they had ever heard it before. The bell of the monastery of their own village ringing for early prayers.

whisper_text: It seemed to me that he despised him for being so simple and docile.

whisper_text: He lay patiently fighting for breath like a child with a group.

whisper_text: The little house on the hillside was so much the color of the night that we could not see it as we came up the draw.

whisper_text: They made me think of defeated armies retreating or of ghosts who were trying desperately to get in for shelter. And then went moaning on.

whisper_text: Antony's father uncovered one of his long, bony legs and rubbed it rhythmically.

whisper_text: They were run out of their village.

whisper_text: and the wolves' pavolast, enough for all of us.

text: THEY WERE WITHIN A FEW MILES OF THEIR VILLAGE NOW
whisper_text: They were within a few miles of their village now.

whisper_text: I could not take my eyes off the man in the bed.

text: HE SEEMED TO BE CURSING PEOPLE WHO HAD WRONGED HIM

whisper_text: Quickly, it was covered with bright red spots. I thought I had never seen any blood so bright.

text: THE SHARP SMELL OF SPIRITS WENT THROUGH THE ROOM

text: YES HOW MANY

whisper_text: Peter told his troubles to Mr. Shimera. He was unable to meet a note which fell due on the 1st of November, had to pay an exorbitant bonus on renewing it, and to give a mortgage on his pigs and horses and even his milk cow.

whisper_text: During the auction, he went about with his head down and never lifted his eyes.

whisper_text: Something happened to the hindmost sledge. The driver lost control. He was probably very drunk. The horses left the road. The sledge was caught up in a clump of trees and overturned.

text: IT WAS THE SEASON WHEN THE ANCIENT SUN GOD HAD BEEN ACCUSTOMED TO RECEIVE HIS ANNUAL OBLATIONS AND WE CAN WELL BELIEVE THAT THOSE WHOSE HEARTS STILL TREMBLED AT THE NAME OF BEL MUST HAVE CONNECTED THE ECLIPSE AND THE PLAGUE WITH THE REVOLUTION IN THE NATIONAL WORSHIP AND THE OVERTHROW OF THE ANCIENT GODS ON THAT PLAIN OF PROSTRATION WHERE THEY HAD SO LONG RECEIVED THE HOMAGE OF AN ENTIRE PEOPLE
whisper_text: It was the season when the ancient sun god had been accustomed to receive his annual ablations, and we can well believe that those whose hearts still tremble that the name of Bell must have connected the eclipse and the plague with the revolution in the national worship and the overthrow of the ancient gods on that plain of prostration, where they had so long received the homage of an entire people.

text: WHILE THE LIBERATED EXILES REJOICED ON THE PLAIN OF MEATH THE TENT OF THE ABBOT OF IONA WAS PITCHED ON THE RATH OF TARA A FACT WHICH WOULD SEEM TO INDICATE THAT ALREADY IN LITTLE MORE THAN A CENTURY SINCE THE INTERDICT HAD FALLEN ON IT THE EDIFICES WHICH MADE SO FINE A SHOW IN THE DAYS OF PATRICK WERE RUINED AND UNINHABITABLE
whisper_text: While the liberated exiles rejoiced on the plane of Meef, the tent of the Abbott of Iona was pitched on the wrath of Tara, a fact which would seem to indicate that already, in little more than a century since the interdict had fallen on it, the edifices which made so fine a show in the days of Patrick were ruined and uninhabitable.

whisper_text: The ancestors of the present pretender, Kongel, surnamed the squint-eyed, had twice received and cherished the licentious bards when under the ban of Tara, and his popularity with that still powerful order was one prop of his ambition.
